name: Tiffany
review_text: We previously had the Keurig K10 Mini, but after 5 years the pump gave out so we decided to "upgrade" to the K250. We had this Keurig for less than 2 weeks and only used it a few times before the error message "brewing interrupted, water under pressure, perform needle maintenance" appeared. We did everything suggested and the error message still appeared. After doing more research, we found this seems to be a common problem. Others noted that it didn't matter what type of water (ex. tap vs bottled) or kcup (approved Keurig vs non-Keurig) was used, they all experienced the same problem. We decided to return ours for a full refund instead of a replacement. Several others noted they were on their third replacement. We didn't want to deal with the hassle of that.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Patricia A. Davis
review_text: This coffee maker has met all my expectations. Once I  found  the coffee blends I  like best, I can have my favorite cup any time of day or any mood. No more wasting pots of coffee. I enjoy tea sometimes and while I can make a cup at a time in the microwave or from hot water in the kettle, this is  still easier. I would not have bought this for tea alone; but, now that I have it...
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: AV
review_text: Great! Makes the coffee super quick and it tastes great. I received 4 sample k-cups, descaling solution and 2 water filters. I bought this to use in my dorm. It doesn't take up too much counter space and it's a beautiful color.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Nick
review_text: Simpley the best cup of coffee and the best coffee maker we have ever owned. So easy to use our 9 year old daughter can use it. Shipping was fast, ordered it Friday night and received it Sunday morning.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Lillian Paula
review_text: If you're shopping for a Keurig you know the basics.  Here's the things that I was looking for that this K250 provided.  (Note - this is our second Keurig, our first model was with us for a good many years but died a slow painful death.  We mourned.  Then we moved on.)
review_title: Petite and colorful - how I like my.....coffee brewers
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Halliecat
review_text: We got this for our travel trailer. Fits great on the counter and love all the colors available. It is a little louder and runs a little longer than our old one, but not a big deal.
review_title: Fits great on the counter and love all the colors available
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: CatFoodJunkie
review_text: This is my 2nd Keurig, and after all the kerfuffle over the k pods - I'm pleased to say this machine takes them all.  It is very chatty and polite and easy to use.  I wish it had an auto off -- my big critique.  I can't say much about the color "plum" as it's more grey and a tad boring, than the plum color I was expecting.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: I love it!!! It was easy to set up, coffee comes out at the perfect temperature. It's astetically pleasing and fits perfectly on my coffee drawer. The only thing I don't like/can't figure out is how to turn the screen off. It has a little power button in the bottom left hand side of the screen, but when I push it it does not turn off. So I unplugged it at night.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: JD
review_text: I have used one at work and so I decided to use it at home.  I love being able to have an extra cup of coffee on the weekends without making a new pot of coffee.  The color is very cool.  So, my son in law made coffee and it blew coffee grounds all over - and it showed a very strange screen I had never seen before - finally figured out what he was doing - when he put the k-cup in he pushed it down to fit - the machine thought we were putting in a caraf size k-cup - soooo, don't push the k-cup down into the holder just set it in and let it bob around until you close the top.  I have had to "whack" the bottom of the machine at work a couple times to get it to come on and pre heat - normally after a long weekend and no one took out the last k-cup so it dried all week end - but it does come back to life when I tip it upside down and smack it a couple times.  It make great tea!  I am still experimenting with the reusable cup with the tiny paper filters - I am gettimg the formula close to the strenghth I like - a dark roast seems to work best.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: DORIS C.
review_text: I really like this little Keurig K250. It is just what I was searching for to make Hot Cocoa.  I am a Hot Cocoa lover.
review_title: Keurig K250: The Best Brewer For Making Hot Cocoa!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: KarenSue32
review_text: I am late to the K-cup trend. Started a new job and they have a very basic other brand k-cup machine.  I fell in love with it. My husband was paying attention as I said I wanted one that could make a stronger cup of coffee so this model was my Christmas present. My kids have used it for hot chocolate and my coffee snob son even gave it a thumbs up.  I like the water reservoir and that you can pick how many ounces you want.  Did I mention I like the  strong  setting?  Just love it .
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Rfeew
review_text: We have had this for over a month and are enjoying it. We did find that even with a solo-clip/k-cup hack, not all brands of coffee pods work well with this machine. Someone had gifted us with a sample pack of k-cups just before our old Keurig quit working and we found we had to cut open some of the pods and use the my k-cup in order to brew them as the k-cups they came packaged in were too "pressurized" and would cause the machine to kick the clean needle message EVERY time we tried to brew one. Other than that, this has worked pretty well so far and will update in time if things change.
review_title: this has worked pretty well so far and will update in time if ...
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Chris Babin
review_text: I have been a long time Keurig user, but this was my first experience with a Keurig 2.0 machine. I had a terrible experience with the K250. Of course, I could use my old reusable coffee filter, so I had to buy a new one. From day one, I got coffee grounds in every cup. I never had this problem with the older unit. Going to a courser grind did help with this problem, but it never completely went away. Then, after only 4 months of use, I started getting only a half cup of coffee. I tried everything recommended online (running cleaning cycles, using the needle cleaning tool, descaling, etc) and could not solve the problem. I gave up in frustration.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Anthony Pegram
review_text: I tried to like this product, but I just can't. K-Cups are as bad as advertised, but I also bought the refillable K-cup from Keurig. This produced a decent cup of coffee, but the last few sips contained grit, so you would basically need to avoid drinking to the bottom of your mug. It also doesn't produce a hot enough brew, the first sip is as if you've already left your mug sitting for a few minutes.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: K. Hayson
review_text: Nice coffee brewer. The color is perfect. The reason I gave this product only three stars is because you cannot use any other kind of KCup except the Keurig brand. I like the Costco brand and it's much cheaper but it apparently clogs the brewing needle that punctures the kcup. Very disappointed. This is the message I get when using another brand.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: william
review_text: If I could vote zero stars, I would have. I wish I had read all the negative reviews before purchasing this expensive piece of crap. I have a larger, commercial size Keurig at home that works great - never had any issues. I bought this one for my office. After only using it twice, it needed maintenance. After messing with it, got it working - then maybe after 2 more cups, broke again. Constantly stops working, stating "water under pressure". Another time, I turned it on and it automatically started filling when I did not even put anything in it - and would not stop until the water reservoir was empty. I've cleaned it numerous times despite only using it maybe 10x.  If I have to perform maintenance on something literally every other time I use it, forget about it. I've discovered the problems I've had are very common with this model. DO NOT BUY THE 2.0!!!!!!!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Millie Bennett
review_text: My biggest complaint is I have to repeatedly respond to the query "would you like to dispense hot water" each time I want a new cup.  WTF?  If I didn't want a hot drink why would I be using a Keurig!?!?  My other big complaint is that the machine seems to require a Keurig carafe in order to brew a carafe.  I had intended to use this Keurig with my own tea pot and find it incredibly mean to force me to spend the additional 30 bucks for the Keurig carafe.  I get that it is a marketing strategy but these machines are not cheap and so unlike printers Keurig should not be trying to make extra money on accessories like this.  I do not recommend buying this machine if you want to do anything other than make one single cup of coffee using all of the required Keurig accessories.
review_title: Of course I want to dispense hot water!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: spie
review_text: This coffee maker works perfectly for me because I am a one cup a day single person (which means that I don't have to fill up the tank every day).I do wish I had picked one that made more than 10 oz, but realistically I probably don't need  more coffee than that. It was a little bigger than I thought it would be, but that's ok too. I love this color. It's a mix of gray and purple which are my two favorite colors. Overall I have no complaints.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: rabbitrabbit
review_text: We love our new Keurig. I had always thought they were just kind of a kitschy thing and wasn't interested in owning one, but when my friend introduced me to hers, I was sold. It's so fast and easy to get a fresh cup ready. It takes maybe a minute tops, so it's perfect if you're on your way out the door and need a beverage fast. I was sure the coffee couldn't taste as good as when I grind my own beans and make an entire pot, but I was wrong. And this way, I'm wasting less precious life elixir because often, a portion of the pot would have to get dumped out. I don't have a pot of coffee sitting on a burner, turning into gross-tasting sludge anymore.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Patriot1776
review_text: Total piece of junk. This is the fourth (seriously) Keurig we have purchased this year. The first two we got from Costco. When the first one futzed out after barely a month, we thought it was just a fluke & that we had been unfortunate enough to get a lemon. We returned it and bought another one (same model, as it was the only Keurig they were selling at the time). That one also developed problems after just a few weeks. It started randomly spewing water even when we weren't doing anything with the machine. It would just spontaneously start up. So, we returned that one as well & got our money back.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Wrekker26
review_text: I have previously owned two older model Keurig units.  All new Keurig machines have a plastic smell/taste from the manufacturing process.  I guess Keurig can't afford to spend a little extra money on cleaning parts before they are assembled.  The problem is the plastic taste leeches into the coffee.  I have thoroughly washed and soaked the removable parts in warm soapy water, run about 50 10 oz servings of water through the machine, as well as as run white vinegar through the machine to try and remove the taste. All told, I have probably spent about 7 hours working on this brewer to remove this disgusting and off putting flavor from my coffee to no avail.  I suspect the fact that the internal tank and the dispensing line from the tank to the K-cup holder are the culprits, but you cannot remove them for cleaning, so your only alternative is to run water through the machine 10 oz at a time in hopes that it will eventually remove the terrible (and probably toxic) plastic taste. I personally will be returning this product and looking for other products.
review_title: Purchase only if you like the taste of plastic and aggravation
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: S. Martin
review_text: Admittedly, I just got this Keurig K250 - but I will update if needed.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Linda S. Sandlin
review_text: Received this brewer and, right out of the box, it didn't work.  Keurig is replacing it and that's good but such a hassle, have to wait again for next one to be delivered and hope it works.  I like the Keurig concept for sure but this is the second one with purchased with problems.
review_title: Keurig is replacing it and that's good but such a hassle
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Daisy
review_text: Just ok. Wish I would of went with the cheaper one.  This one is very picky and won t use a pod unless it is Keurig.  Seems to take longer to warm up then my last cheaper one.  Also the water container is smaller.
review_title: Just ok. Wish I would of went with the ...
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: AKN
review_text: This is my first Keurig coffee maker.  I love it.  I've used them before and I was always impressed with them.  This one is a nice compact size with just the basic functions, including making three different sizes of cups of coffee, carafe, or large travel mug size.  This also has a strong setting for an extra strong brew.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Sandra L. Ober
review_text: I really like this machine, I love the beige color as it matches with my new kitchen.  The water tank is a decent size, a little larger would have been even better.  I just wish Keurig wasn't so money-grabbing so that you had to use their k-cups.  I would have purchased a different brand if I found one I liked at much as this one.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Aly B
review_text: This machine will fail you.  Bought in June, 2017 and it died the day before Christmas 6 months later.  When it ran it was a good machine but for the price I paid and the care that I gave it this should not have happened.  Granted this is not the big Keurig but for a large corporation to sell this machine for almost $100 and it completely dies inside of a year is bad manufacturing.  They wanted for me to ship to them and then ship back for what I bought another machine made by Hamilton Beach cost in total.  The HB takes 30 sec more time to brew but tbh I really love the setup more.  Way more space to put larger mugs and the baskets for pods or your own ground roast is so much simpler. I'm actually much happier with this machine just wish I hadn't wasted the money on the Keurig. Can't speak for it's longevity yet but I know I won't have to spend so much in upkeep as with the Keurig products they specify must be used to clean their machines.  Too much upkeep and too much money. Good buy Keurig.
review_title: When it ran it was a good machine but for the price I paid and the ...
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Tammy N.
review_text: I previously owned a Keurig 2.0 that I bought in 2015 at Walmart. I was very happy with that machine, right up to the point that it died a week ago.  I decided to go with the K250 on Amazon because it was smaller and would take up less counter space.  I've owned the machine for 4 days, and I am returning it today.  Here's why.  The 40 oz water reservoir is too small.  I like to brew a 16 oz cup of coffee, and you only get 2 cups before you have to remove the reservoir and refill it.  It's a total pain unless your unit is sitting right next to the sink (which mine is not; nor would it fit).  Also, this appears to be the ONLY Keurig model that doesn't have an auto off feature. My 12-year-old son brewed a cup of hot chocolate before he went to bed last night, and the machine stayed on all night. It smelled like something was burning this morning from the heating element being on all night.  I don't understand why all models wouldn't have an auto off feature. Finally, it takes this model forever to preheat, and it needs to preheat between each brew. This is also a pain. I am going to try the K475 because I need an auto off, and I like the touch screen. Hopefully, that experience will be better.
review_title: No Auto Off Feature; Small Water Reservoir
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Pedro Nova
review_text: It makes great coffee but it is a piece of plastic. Mine keeps showing a message on screen, even if I do the Needle Maintenance several times, it won't work. Hot water for tea keeps coming out dirty. Bought it 3 months ago. Only brewed 15-20 cups.
review_title: Godd coffee but piece of plastic.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: A. SF.
review_text: The idea is great, the design is perfect, the function is there. It's really fast and I love everything about it except the taste of the coffee. I tried all settings, strong, weak, 4 oz, 6 oz, 8 oz - everything.
review_title: The function is there, but there's no taste in coffee that comes out
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: DaveSam
review_text: I have searched the web trying to find something that would get a decent cup of coffee out of this thing, but nothing has helped. I use the re-usable pod with a couple of my favorite dark roast and after selecting 6 ounces and strong brew, I get what tastes like plastic tea water. I've cleaned it, use the filters, tried several different grinds...nothing.
review_title: Ok if you don't like great coffee
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: AmazonDenizen
review_text: We replaced our K575 because it kept clogging and ran slow.  This one brews faster and hotter than the one it replaced.  It's far less expensive and correspondingly less fancy (monochrome screen instead of color, plastic drip tray cover instead of stainless, etc.), but truthfully the only difference I care about is that the water reservoir is half the size.  If this could hold at least 60oz, I would have given it 5 stars.  That said, I like the small footprint and if I have to make a few extra trips to the fridge, then so be it.
review_title: Smaller footprint than more expensive models, at the cost of a smaller tank
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: IrishLass
review_text: So far so good.  This will be my 4th Keurig in several years.  We had a 2 smaller ones and a larger one.  They always worked...we sold them...moved into a small place with a smaller kitchen and needed a smaller footprint again.  I was going back and forth with this K250 or the 55. Happy with this one.  It doesn't take up much space and works beautifully after a month.  We'll see how long it lasts after reading other reviews.  I love the smaller size and the water reserve is handy vs. the one cup ones.  But I really did a silly thing at first.....setting it up was easy but I kept hitting the round button in the beginning trying to get it to work....then....duh....I realized you had to actually hit the little square touch screen on the front first so it heats up the water..........THEN........hit the little round button.  Would help to read the instructions first lol  I almost thought I got a dud....but it was just me :)  Nice little coffee maker...but then again I've always loved my Keurigs! Amazon was their usual perfect fast shipping....so all good!
review_title: Love this model of Keurig....nice smaller footprint for smaller kitchens!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: virtueofpatience
review_text: Nothing but trouble until it broke in less than a week!  I have invested way too much in pods, carafe, drawer, scooper, filters etc and now they are sending me a replacement machine!  Tried a keurig pod and grounds got into the machine and took me hours to clean it out only for it to happen again.  Cold coffee, weak and the smallest little cup for over a dollar for 4 ounces.  I clearly did not do my homework before investing.
review_title: Do your homework before picking the right machine and good luck getting a good cup of coffee or good sip of coffee!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Stephanie
review_text: I just received my Keurig in the color "oasis". I'm absolutely enamored with it! This device has a pretty small footprint and comes in visually appealing colors.
review_title: Simple and pretty device makes great coffee!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Animal Lover
review_text: I didn't want an electronic Keurig as they have had issues. I have had two previous Keurig coffee makers with the buttons but the last one which I had for over 3 years finally died. Keurig machines were almost all electronic when I purchased this - love the various cup sizes (waned 4 oz because I like stronger coffee) and also the Strong Brew button. This had both. It also had the best reviews of all the Keurig electronic makers. I have had zero issues with this machine. I notice Keurig has fazed out other electronic machines and gone back to the buttons, but this one is still in their lineup. I am very happy with this coffee maker, it has smaller footprint than my previous Keurig & very easy to refill water. Recommend
review_title: Have had no issues with the electronics - very happy with this model
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: C. Gerber
review_text: Great product for k-cups and it was the color I wanted for my kitchen instead of the typical black ones found at my local retail stores.  This is my second k-cup maker.  I didn't realize, however, that you have to buy certified Keurig k-cups only to use with this brewer model.  Of course, there are workarounds for this problem that can be found on the web.  Keurig should re-think this as many people love to buy variety k-cup packs from coffee bean companies all over the world, as I do.  The problem didn't keep me from using the coffeemaker, it was just an annoyance that was easily remedied.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Jerry C Maniscalco Jr
review_text: The machine itself is great, but had to return this one because it was dysfunctional. Received he product in original packaging, but found water in the inside so I'm wondering if it had been previously returned. We set it up anyway and figured we'd just make sure it was cleaned properly before use. Once clean, we noticed that every time we made coffee, there were a lot of grounds in the cup. We tried it multiple times over the course of a few days and unfortunately it didn't get any better. We returned and purchased the same model from a different retailer and haven't had any problems with grounds.
review_title: Great product, but received a defective one initially
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Graham
review_text: I bought this keurig used and I got a incredible deal! Come to find out this product was never used kuerig gave me a 1 year warenty when i called and please note if brewing tea either use the k cup teas do not brew a tea bag in a reuseable filter first put the tea bag in you cup then brew water only in your keurig into the cup with the tea bag. Also reusable k cup pod is only meant for ground coffee only not coco or tea in a teabag or do not open the tea bag and put tea leafs in a reusable pod only use kcup store bought for tea . For coco either use a kcup store bought coco or put it in a empty cup then brew only water through the machine into the cup. Putting coco in a reuseable pod or tea in a reuable pod will cause harm to the machine because it will not pour correctly threw th pod may clog the machine. If you do use a reusable pod only put ground coffee in a pod only. Or just use a store bought tea kcup or store bought kcup coco pod if brewing in your keurig . I called keurig before i used my machine and the told me these helpful facts. So now you know ,have a good day!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: loriann
review_text: So I put off buying one of these for several reasons. One being that I think the k-cups are incredibly wasteful and not environmentally friendly. The second being that I wasn't sure it would brew a great cup of coffee. I use the filter cup and man, does this thing brew a great cup of coffee! I feel that there is very little waste involved and my morning cup is delish! Perfect for someone who doesn't need more than one (maybe two cups) in the morning
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: LaurasGreenEyes
review_text: It's so much superior to older coffee makers. We love ours and the color is so pretty. Be certain to get the correct size cups or you have to trick the machine by taking the foil off of the new pods and using that to cover the outdated pods and trick the machine to brew. The color is gorgeous and it's touch screen.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Housttx
review_text: This is a good machine except for one major problem, the water tank. At 40oz It is much smaller than other models that hold 70oz. I feel like i am always putting water into this thing. It does have a smaller footprint than other models, but i would give up the space for the larger resovoir. Also the placement of the tank is awkward and the lid always has condensate and will drip on you or the counter when you remove it.
review_title: Saves counter space, but at a cost
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Brandon Powell
review_text: Hate this product.  I've had a Keurig for the last 9 yrs & when it died last week I decided to buy a new one.  I had no idea to get the same mug of coffee I've gotten for the past 9 yrs I'd have to buy something called a Kmug which is a lot more expensive than the already expensive Kcups.  I will be selling this scam & replacing it with something that will give me a travel mug size of coffee.
review_title: Don't be fooled into thinking you can make a travel size unless ypu plan to buy more expensive kcups
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: David P. Smith
review_text: This is replacing an older Keurig machine.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Jes
review_text: It's a beautiful color,  very happy with my choice.  Very easy to use, doesn't take up too much space and fits well in a corner on a wood tray.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: eeternal16
review_text: I love the red and the small footprint. The water tank is hard to fill as it sits underneath my cabinet and is not easily accessible. You have to take off the whole lid and then clumsily maneuver to fill it. I am getting a new kitchen faucet soon with a side sprayer, which will make it all easier. I love the features, the temperature of the coffee and it's quick and quiet. The digital read out is nice. I had an older model that never made hot coffee and clogged constantly. I'm very pleased!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Paula DeMontmollin
review_text: We previously had 2 cuisinart machines which lasted 3 years and 2 1/2 years .  This time we decided to go with a Keurig as we've bought them as gifts for our kids and never heard complaints.  I chose this one because of the carafe option, which my husband loves.  Other than that, we hate it. It is the worst coffee maker I've ever used. It constantly stops and asks to have needle cleaning done. Throw out the kcup and clean the needle.  Brew a couple of days then the same thing.  Have changed the filters approximately once a week.  Even when it is working it is slow, slow, slooow.  You have to wait between one cup and the next for it to "preheat."  It is loud.  My husband imitates the sounds it makes - about the only time we smile about it.  This is ridiculous for a machine that was not cheap.  Now I'm trying to decide if I want another so we can use the carafe & 2.0 kcups.  Really not sure....I'm afraid it will be a case of throwing good money after bad.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Donald M Marchetti
review_text: works great----wish had greater water capacity ----have to continually fill.  Don M
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Chelle
review_text: This is my third Keurig. The first one I handed down to my stepson for his Fire house. The second actually died. I didn't buy another for a while because I was getting my coffee when I got to work. I eventually decided I need it when I get up so I bought this one. I liked that I can make a carafe when I have company.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: JRW
review_text: Great product. But we did have the plastic smell to start. I cleaned it with small amount of white vinegar (did not run that solution through it, just soaked and washed all of the parts with it). Worked like a charm.
review_title: Great product. But we did have the plastic smell ...
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: J. Aceti
review_text: Plenty has been written about the quality of these coffee machines - and for that  I give the product 5 stars.  But there is one pet peeve that I have against the product and that is that it will just not work with some K-cups.  In particular the San Francisco brand is a great coffee but their K-cups will not work in this K250 - the coffee maker senses something with the K-cup and refuses to proceed.  I get the argument that the machine is protecting itself and the user - but there is no threat with either with the aforementioned K-cups.
review_title: Great product - with one irksome flaw
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Johnny Shoponline
review_text: I love this coffee maker.  It's the first Keurig I've ever owned so I don't have much to compare it to.  But the coffee is hot and delicious.  It's as quiet as my regular previous coffee maker ever was, and it's quick.  Even if you don't leave it on with the water pre-heated, it only takes a minute to pre-heat the water, then a few seconds to brew the cup.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Tab
review_text: This Keurig is beaut! My husband and I recently added a kitchen to our downstairs and wanted to add a pop of color against the black and grey...the aqua color did not disappoint (see picture). Besides the amazing color, it works like a charm! The instructions explain everything you need to know to get started, and they even include some extra goodies. The reservoir provides the perfect amount of water for both of us, without having to refill it every day.
review_title: the aqua color did not disappoint (see picture)
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Pat in VA
review_text: I purchased this for a vision impaired 84-year-old aunt who loves her coffee in the mornings. Her helpers make sure the reservoir is filled. I needed something simple to use. There is only one button so she can work it by touch. There is a touch screen but for a basic cup of coffee this is perfect for her.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: AMR
review_text: I love this machine. It is easy and quick in the morning, and Keurig s customer service cannot be beat. I have used the cups, but prefer the reusable cup. Most of my travel mugs do not fit in it, but for some I just slide the piece that the mug sits on out and they usually fit then.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Lamarr A. Wilson
review_text: I have owned several Keurig brewers and this is the worse brewing product I've ever used!!  It is absolutely not user friendly and, to top it off, it is slow.  One of the previous advantages to using a single cup system like Keurig was the ability to get "a cup on the fly" and be out the door.  Not with the K250.  Then there are the constant and relentless "chore" reminders and demands.  Using the needle cleaner is a time consuming waste of time as it never seems to get it clean enough to shut the "chore" reminder off.  Descaling reminders are another joke.  After going through the process, by-the-book, the reminder persists until it gets ready to stop.  Both of these annoyances are cancelled until next time by unplugging and rebooting the brewer.  Another massive waste of time!  The entire needle/cup mechanism is beyond the average user's ability to use without reading and re-reading the instructions.  Just making a cup of coffee using an approved Keurig cup/pod results in grounds in the bottom of your beverage very often.  And, a major selling point that seems to be all hype is the canister feature.  First off, the canister is a piece of junk that isn't insulated nor sealable, therefore not usable as a carafe; and, the carafe pods only work about half the time, with the grounds in the bottom still a problem.  Not worth the time, inconvenience nor money invested in nothing more than a "pitcher" with a lid on it.  And, the "use your own coffee" feature pretty much follows the trend of being all hype.  Again, the primary problem is trying to use the needle mechanism.  Its in the way more than its useful!!  Keurig engineers and quality control people need to go back to the drawing board on this one and rely more on using the man/woman on the street as product testers and not some payed employee.  Another case of "more is not always better".
review_title: Keurig K250 not ready for prime time!!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: JD-BoilerUp
review_text: Frequent errors during brewing.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Venessa
review_text: Do not buy a Keurig from Amazon! I bought this product less than two months ago and it stopped working! It started spewing out coffee grinds and the coffee tastes awful! The only reason I purchased from amazon was because I really liked the teal color. My gut was to go with Costco but they don t have the same color selections. Now we are left with a broken coffee maker, past the return date, that makes cofffee filled with grinds. I love amazon for a lot of things, but you cannot best Costco s return policy. I m so mad that an expensive profit would stop working less than TWO MONTHS after purchase!
review_title: Stopped working after TWO MONTHS!!!!!! Do not buy!!!!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: TNman
review_text: I have owned a Keurig for several years. When coffee is brewing with this model it sounds like and old car about to throw a rod or an old style washing machine. Ka-chug, Ka-chug, Ka-chug until the coffee is brewed. The noise has even woke my wife in the morning. I recommend Keurig but NOT this model.
review_title: Not Good if you Like a QUIET morning
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Irene Haskins
review_text: This is the best Keurig ever!! The first one I bought it was too hard for me to use because I am terrible with figuring out stuff. But this one tells you what exactly to do and to add more water and everything it s a smart keurig to be exact!! I love it and the color I picked out is so elegant and exactly what I was going for to match my decor for my coffee bar! So worth the purchase!!!
review_title: PERFECT!!!! My Coffee Bar is COMPLETE!!!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Snow
review_text: Brought this for the office. It works like it is supposed to but the downside is you have to have the mug pods for it to make the bigger size servings. I wanted one where I could make a 12 ounce cup with a regular pod. I just maybe the new Select model with do that. I can't fit my larger travel mug under it without putting the machine on a box or a stack of magazines. If you want a regular 8 or 10 ounce cup of coffee, this will do the job. I really like the color! We do have to fill the water a little more often in this one than in the original but that was expected due to it being mention in the reviews.
review_title: It works like it is supposed to but the downside is you ...
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Adela
review_text: Awesome! I love the multitude of drinks I can make with this. I am not gonna lie, some drinks seem watered down  (for example the hot cocoa that comes in the sample size with the machine), but at the end of the day it comes down to the brand of coffee you get and not to the machine itself. Even if only half of the options taste good, that's a good deal for me. Also, make sure you use filtered water and not tap water. It will make maintenance and cleaning so much easier.
review_title: Awesome! I love the multitude of drinks I can ...
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Sean P.
review_text: I love the color of the keurig! Although the material that's it's made of, unfortunately looks  cheap. The machine comes with a water  filter system to purify the water. It comes with one water filter, which is nice. The most amount of coffee it can make in one serving is 10 ounces(it also has the option of 8 oz). I would liked it to have been at least 12oz (one cup). Overall, I am enjoying my new keurig
review_title: I love the color of the keurig
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Melody Faith Mullins
review_text: I have loved this machine but the hard part is there are areas you simply can t get to clean. After having two bugs seek it s warmth and crawl out, I can t deal with the fact that I can t thoroughly clean every part.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Jason Welker
review_text: I have had this Keurig for a couple months now.  I originally purchased it to put in our travel trailer, but I decided to put it in our kitchen & put the old one in the camper.  It has worked great so far.  We use the reusable filter with it, so we can save money & that works great as well.  The only bad part is that you have to buy the Keurig filter made specifically for this coffee maker.  Not a big deal.  I found it on Amazon too & it is very good quality.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: VideoGuy
review_text: I was certain it wasn t properly filling my coffee mug. Because it has 6, 8 & 10 oz settings, I decided to measure the output for each quantity. In fact, it s working just fine with correct levels of output. No complaints.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Kass
review_text: I got this because my K55 bit the dust. This one seems fancy but I there are a few things about it that drive me crazy. For some reason I get the pressure error quite often even after using the orange cleaning thing that it came with. I also feel that it doesn t hold as much water as my old one. I do wish it would remember my last setting because I like doing the 10oz strong but as soon as I put in a new pod it goes back to 8oz regular.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: George G. Whitehead
review_text: Makes a great cup of coffee time after time.  I am pleased with the consistency of the coffee taste.  I drink Folgers, so the k-cups are readily available.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Mombee
review_text: I love the dusty purple color, and yes, it does lean more toward gray.  It fits nicely in my master bath for an early morning quiet cup of coffee.  I appreciate the wide variety of water quantity, 4 oz, up to 10 oz.  I like coffee weak so brew it with the most water and then also add another 4 oz. of hot water from the Keurig.  My daughter uses the least amount of water to make strong coffee for adding to ice.  Very pleased with this new model and color.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Lisa M.
review_text: I absolutely LOVE this Keurig model! So far works great ! Love the choices for strength and size of coffee oz and you can program to let you know when to add water!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: bonnie
review_text: So far, I love this machine.  I have tried 3 different keurigs this year and had trouble with all of them.  I tried a Cuisenart and that was DOA so ordered this one and it is working great.  The water reservoir is in the back so it is hard to fill and the reservoir doesn't hold a lot of water.  But that is minor.  The coffee tastes so much better than any of my other coffee makers.  I highly recommend.  I don't recommend the K475, K50's.  Bad.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: JET
review_text: Malfunctions 3 out of 4 attempts. Screeches at times so loudly it interrupts conversations next door. Requires water fill after 2 8 oz cups, and after a malfunction. Error message nearly every attempt. Either I got a lemon, or it was discontinued because they are all lemons. Returned.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Erika Colbrunn
review_text: I bought this for a dorm room since it was very cute and not too expensive. The color is great but it is a bit larger than i expected (should have looked at the dimensions oops). It is very deep but is overall low profile from the front. I've had it for a week now and the only suggestion that I have is to cycle it through with water 10+ times before using it. The water smelled a little funky at first, but cycling made a big difference. Overall I am happy with this purchase and it will save boatloads of money that would have been spent on Starbucks!
review_title: A little larger than expected, but works great! One Suggestion...
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Kristen Knight
review_text: We have been Keurig owners for the last 7 or 8 years. I loved my Keurig, which plugged away all that time with no issues. I was saddened to notice that it was slowly dying, but thrilled with the amount of use we had gotten out of this small appliance. I was apprehensive about ordering a new model having heard all kinds of issues with the new machines but finally had no choice. I was right to be concerned about the new generation of Keurigs. I got one cup of coffee out of this machine before it started giving me the "Water under pressure...perform the needle cleaning procedure" message. I've done this multiple times, unplugged the machine, cleaned out the K-cup areas...still get the error. After doing some internet searching this is a very common problem. I cannot get it to brew an entire cup of coffee. I do not understand why manufacturers insist on "improving" products to the point where they no longer function, but that is the case with this machine. Guess I'm going to have to find a new brand of coffee maker.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Bridget Rogman
review_text: My old keurig just died after 2 years and so I was excited to upgrade. However, since getting this I am nothing but disappointed. I miss my old one! I hate how the water container is put into this one. Much harder to get in. It randomly has a water pressure error and spills coffee grounds into my cup and all over the machine. It takes longer to heat up and is noisier than the old one. The only thing I like about it is the peacock blue color. I am very unhappy with everything else about this machine and will be returning it.
review_title: They may have upgraded the look of the machine but they downgraded the rest.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: MARILYN
review_text: Read the instructions.  Added the filter after it soaked and rinsed.  Filled the 40 ounce  reservoir.  Odd the only amount of coffee I rec'd was a 1/2 cup no matter what size I chose!  Hated it and sent it back the same day.  (I didn't care that the box said one thing and the inside was another model I knew that from reading the information.  It was the same amount of coffee every time I made a selection) .
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Aviator
review_text: Pressure malfunction after only 2 weeks.  Every 3rd or 4th pod is an error, even using OEM Keurig pads...very annoying.  This is a replacement unit and the first one did the exact same thing.  The 2.0 machines are a poor design and thankful Amazon is taking it back again.
review_title: very annoying. This is a replacement unit and the first ...
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Jennie N
review_text: Order came quick. All items included are just as described. Was an easy set up. I ve used other model keurigs before but this is my first for this model. The color is great and fits perfect on top of rolling drawer. Did not give full 5 stars because this is first day using just after delivery, but from experience from other model keurigs, this should not disappoint as long as used as directed & maintain properly.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Jack W.
review_text: First review on Amazon. Replaced an older broken keurig with this one. After two weeks I started getting this error "k cup not for use with this brewer" even though there was no k cup in the machine. Customer support wasn't helpful. I'll probably go for a refund rather than replace. Or bite the cost and take it out back and use it for target practice. Would probably be more satisfying. Hope this helps you decision...
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Kevin H.
review_text: Not very pleased with this product right now. It keeps reading that something is wrong with the dispensing needle. So have to unplug the machine so it resets .
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: SCUBA
review_text: Basically like old Keurig except serving size.Starts out way to small and comes up to regular coffee mug size.Only thing it has different is button for strong brewing.Water tank about half the size of old one.Motor sounds cheap.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: J
review_text: This is our second Keuirg and we were not disappointed. The color is beautiful and works well for our kitchen. So far we have only used it a few times and haven't had any issues. It's quiet, user friendly, and doesn't take up a large environmental footprint. I only wish it made a bigger cup of coffee than 10oz and had a timer. We also measured the amount of coffee it put out and it was spot on!
review_title: Our second Keurig, we love it
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Scott Davidson
review_text: Awful product. Never has worked. Bought for my basement and when family went to use it, it keeps saying "more water please." No fix will work. The product support is even worse as now, 3 months later, its ineligible for a return or support. Buyer beware...
review_title: The product support is even worse as now
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Linda J. Zwart
review_text: So disappointed. I had a perfectly working older Keurig which I thought I would give to a friend and I would get a new one. But when after cleaning it for the first time before using it, I just didn t like it. First, the  minimum waterline is 1  below the maximum line! This means I have to refill the water reservoir after each cup. I could get 3 or 4 cups of the same size cup with my older Keurig. Secondly, it takes so much longer to heat up, close to three minutes. Plus it takes way too long to heat up in between cups. There again, my old one did not need to reheat in between cups, and the water reservoir was almost empty.  And lastly, when it stops brewing the coffee is not hot and has an odd aftertaste. So now I m stuck with this as it would be too expensive to send back. And I just bought five boxes of Starbucks coffee k-cups to use with this!  I want my old Keurig back!  I have fixed at least 15 cups of coffee with this since I received it and it hasn t improved as far as taste and heat.  I almost want to apologize for not being able to write a positive review because I absolutely love Keurig but it is what it is.
review_title: I want my old Keurig back!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Joe Weber
review_text: I use it every morning and have been for the past few months.  I have had no issues with it and it always makes a great cup of coffee.  The size settings are great for when I need a little more to fill my travel mug and the built in water filter makes the coffee taste even better.  I would buy another one in a heartbeat.  Not many options available int he K-Mug size but if you buy the reusable filter (a must) then you can make whatever coffee you want.  You just may have to make 2 pods worth to fill a big travel mug.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Chris
review_text: I am very pleased with my new Keurig. I like that it tells me when I need to add more water and when it is time to clean it. This product is great for making a quick cup of coffee and no messy coffee grounds. I also like that I don't have to worry abut coffee grounds getting into my cup. I hate taking a drink of coffee and having a mouth full of grounds. This is one of the best products on the market today for making coffee. I would recommend this product to all my friends and family, it is great.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: M. D. Minuth
review_text: At first, I thought it was broken because I couldn't turn it on. I was following the instructions, and I was familiar with Keurigs at the office. This was an upscale model, so I didn't realize that even though it has this big button on it, I actually had to touch the screen to turn it on. It serves me well for tea pods, coffee pods, or hot water. Love it! Great color, too. The color is more vibrant than the dull picture, partly because it's a glossy finish rather than a dull finish.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: kllucci
review_text: This wasn't the greatest coffee maker for my situation. I bought this for when my adult children come home to visit. I am not a coffee drinker myself. I did not realize that the Keurig stores approximately 1 cup of water internally and is not meant to be emptied. I did find a combination of turning it upside down, pushing the suction release all just after unplugging (still warm) that will empty it. Otherwise the water would sit inside the machine, eventually creating mold for the 4-6 months in between visits from children. Otherwise, it works fine.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Lola
review_text: Good for Keurig and American expectations only. No espresso or self measuring of water or coffee - only multiple standard choices.
review_title: Good for Keurig and American expectations only
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Baltimore sports fan
review_text: A bit smaller than older model but works great!  No issues noted after many months of daily use.  Primary drawback is that for a cup 8oz is the largest size, so unless I buy a carafe for it doesn't fill my travel mug for work.  I do like the option to make your cup strong, as some light roasts have very mild flavors and making it strong brings more flavor out.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: pat burg
review_text: It works well and does what it is supposed to do. The coffee maker appears smaller than it is in the photo. It is actually as big as my regular coffee maker and I was expecting it to be smaller. The choices of cup size are too limited. The large cup show in the photo would require you to run it twice to get a full cup. The largest size you can select is 10 oz.  I am satisfied with it for now but it is not what I expected.
review_title: Works well but is larger than it appears in photo.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: iamasoul
review_text: It s the best of all Keurigs I ve used.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: 1 poodle lover
review_text: I'm now a coffee drinker. Who would of thought since I'm 65 yrs old. Love the ease of a single cup and the coffee never taste bitter from sitting in a pot. Could be on the expensive side if you drink a lot but I don't. Love having the water container on the backside and love the red. Got on sale. Cheaper then the stores by $15. Enjoy
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: justin b
review_text: Had soooo many troubles with a cheaper Keurig model. Since switching to this one, we have had zero issues. Knock on wood. Like the options to fill up an entire mug with the fill your own k cups. Great coffee every time. We have been performing the regular descaling and cleaning of needles. Seems to keep it going!
review_title: Performs great! Best coffee maker I've owned.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Nashville Cat
review_text: Well, in my endless search for the perfect cup of coffee, I've tried many systems, some of which I've reviewed here.  There are certainly better ways to make coffee than this type, but convenience wins for me right now.  This makes a decent cup of coffee, if you use well regarded brands.  I would not use this system if I consumed many cups of coffee a day -- it is just too wasteful.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Double AA
review_text: Good: Good price. came with water filters, water cleaning solution. Easy setup/install. Shipped super quick
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: Well, I have had past Keurig machines have early failures with various sealed system, pump failures so there is no real way to repair them. I am hoping this one is a better model and will last longer. But for a few dollars more, I took out the Amazon insurance. So, we shall see!
review_title: I am hoping this one is a better model and will last longer
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Starbright
review_text: Very happy with this appliance. Just sliding out the stand the cup sits on allows for a larger coffee mug or carafe. There is something like 7-1/8  to 7-1/4  clearance from the countertop, with the the stand removed, to the bottom of the dispenser.
review_title: Finally a fresh cup any time I want.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Pamela
review_text: This Keurig is perfect for my office space.  I mostly drink tea and usually have instant oatmeal for breakfast.  This machine brews perfect k-cup teas and dispenses hot water for my instant oatmeal.  I can adjust the amount of water that comes out 4, 6, 8 or 10 ozs.  I love it.
review_title: Perfect for my personal office space
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Kindle Customer
review_text: I love this pot, but it has a bad flaw--you cannot remove the water that sits inside the pot.  This is a major problem, when I would like to leave this pot in my camper over winter....I cannot---because 6 cups of water is inside of it.  and is not removable.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: Good color.  Only thing about it that I don't like is it doesn't turn of automatically after being on for a while.  And there were no instructions about how to turn it off.  Had to call customer service to find out that you have to hold the power button in to turn it off.
review_title: Good color. Only thing about it that I don't ...
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: CNHens
review_text: My husband uses this every day. It's nice that he doesn't wake me up when he goes to work super early to make him coffee, its quick and easy.
review_title: It's nice that he doesn't wake me up when he goes ...
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: MN Lakes Girl
review_text: This thing sucked! I got it all setup according to the directions no problem. Went to brew a cup of coffee and got a "water pressure" error. Went through the directions to reset it and the same thing happened!!! So frustrating. I returned it right away.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Carrie Phelps
review_text: LOVE This version. I spent $60 less than my last model and this one delivers a much better product. Heats up quicker, less errors regarding K-cups. It has been nice having this model. Coffee brews hotter and quicker. Much better than I expected.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Michele Marie
review_text: This item is the worst choice. The coffee from the very first was weak and just warm
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: tk
review_text: Disappointed. The coffee made by this machine lacks in flavor... I tried to add more coffee in a reusable pod and tried "Strong" setting but it just doesn't make good coffee. I bought a carafe as well but it just makes coffee flavored hot water. I'm going to return it and purchase a regular coffee maker.
review_title: Disappointed. The coffee made by this machine lacks in ...
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Elayne D. Weinberg
review_text: disappointed in Keurig.  Two months in and having issues with the sensor working properly.  Need to unplug wait a few moments then re-plug the cord. Takes several attempts to start it, to set strong coffee and ounces size. Any suggestions besides letting me return it.  Thank you
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Atalia
review_text: I love that this product has multiple functions! You can brew a small or large cup, make your coffee stronger if you'd like as well. The best part has to be that it functions with the Keurig 2.0 Thermal Carafe! Just simply place the carafe under the Keurig and select how much coffee you'd like to brew! I would definitely recommend this Keurig to anyone! whether you're new to Keuirg and their products or been a user for years. It's simple and easy to brew your favorite cup of coffee.
review_title: Simple and easy to brew your favorite cup of coffee!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: LA
review_text: I'm am impressed, not that it has been improved-simply that it is as the first Keurigs were, no consistency in the amount  of water going into your cup- that remains as it has been since the beginning,  consistently  1/2 cup of coffee. Nope, they still haven't changed their "Lets keep 'em guessing" mantra!!  So here's how it works people.. You pop your pod in and you select 8 oz, where upon you will get roughly 6 oz, (yes I measured)  The good thing is you can change the setting to say.. 10 oz or 16 oz where upon you get 8 oz!! (No matter if you choose 10 or 12 its gonna be 8!!)   neat huh?  one description indicated the cool feature, that you can select a 12 oz setting for a travel mug-  I thought we would love this feature, only-not one,.. nary a one..of our travel mugs will fit under the dispenser, so you will need to fill a regular cup and transfer that to your travel mug.. let's see are there any other impressive features??...??..?? Oh yes!!  The power button works about 20% of the time, so I just unplug it and then we are back to square 1, I mean really people.. Are we expecting something that we dropped 116 bucks on.. to have a working power button?!?!  Talk about wanting to live in a privileged society.. sheesh-
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Victoria
review_text: I ordered this Keurig coffee maker. Great color, delivery was awesome!  The only problem I have it that after a few times I've made coffee, I get the error message that i need to take out the inside cup, follow the manual instructions, for maintenance, but after all that, I still get the "maintenance" message.  I like the older keurig model better.  This is/has seem to be a not so good purchase.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Riki
review_text: Accidentally ordered the wrong keurig for my boyfriend but it ended up being fine. Then the grounds kept seeping into the coffee cup. Tried using the cleaning device(orange)but it would not fit. Was able to use for about a week error free. Can not even use anymore just gives an error code. When I called the number to solve the problem all I got was horrible customer service was trying to blame me for a disfunctional device.
review_title: Broke after 1st week customer service is rude and unhelpful
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Dan Pointer
review_text: Update - After 2 months of daily use this developed an overpowering burnt plastic taste that I could not get rid of.  It's been sitting on the shelf for the year since.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: DragonLady1958
review_text: Great little coffee maker. I had the bigger one, but it died on me. I'm having to get used to the smaller reservoir & this one's a little noisier, but the coffee gets made pretty fast, so that makes up for it. Love the color, too!! I'd recommend this, but keep in mind I've only had it about a week.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: ABG
review_text: Probably got a lemon. Leaked after the brew. Sometimes would not brew the correct amount.... puzzling. Good Seller, took care of the return.
review_title: Good Seller, took care of the return
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: JHDK
review_text: Can't go wrong with Keurig.  This machine does everything I need from a coffee maker and the price was right!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Susan
review_text: I tried 4 pod coffee makers before this one. This checks all the boxes for me: smaller footprint, stores water, travel mugs fit under the dispenser, it doesn't make a big, drippy mess, makes a good, hot cup of coffee....I love it!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Dan
review_text: It does what it should for the price, but the water tank is relatively small and it need more cup sizes to chose from.  I have two Vue-Cup makers and they hold enough water to make several cups without adding more and are more adjustable for cup sizes..  I guess it's a trade-off though;  the K-Cup pods are much cheaper than the Vues.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Gary A
review_text: We have owned 3 Keurig units, and all have them have had a short life. We prefer the large reservoir feature, but this Keurig has only lasted 90 days, and now it is showing signs of problems, i.e., it stays on "prehearing", So we have to keep lifting the handle and other tricks to reset it. Our previous Keurig, a $150 unit lasted only a year. We are looking at other brands, but there is only one other brand I have seen on Amazon with a 40 oz reservoir. If I decide to buy another Keurig, I will have to buy the warranty this time. I have asked Amazon if there is at least a 90 day warranty on this one, so maybe we can get this replaced. I am not optimistic. Several of my friends own Keurigs, with mixed opinions. One friend has owned multiple units just as we have, and have a similar experience. One other friend has the $250 unit, and has served him well for years. Is this how much money I need to spend to get a reliable Keurig? We drink a lot of coffee and tea, but I can't imagine we are overworking the unit in only 3 months.
review_title: Short product life - best to buy a warranty
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Tracy J McGriff
review_text: Love it!!!  I also purchased the "Full Menu Clip, Metal Freedom Clip Compatible with All Keurig 2.0 brewers (including K200/K250 and plus models), 2 pack" so that I could use non-keurig pods and access the menu for travel mugs.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Terry Pratt
review_text: This is my second Keurig machine and I just love them, I can't imagine being without one now they make a perfect cup every time and now this new one gives the option on strength of coffee brewing and just after thinking it couldn't get any better.  WOW so perfect.
review_title: This is my second Keurig machine and I just love them, I can't imagine being without one now ...
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Portrait 101
review_text: I purchased the keurig against my better judgement after reading tons of bad reviews from tons of different sites.. So far so good.. I use the 8o clock pods and the coffee is excellent in an 8 ounce cup.. A reminder.. find the serial number b4 setting up the coffee maker.. this model is on the colored plastic behind the clear warer reservoir.. other are on the bottom.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Carol Fecker
review_text: Love the color and it has a smaller footprint on the counter.....only two adults use it daily so it contains enough water.....the on and off button seems to be a little touchy.....hope it does not become a problem
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Tammy Anderson
review_text: I love this coffee maker! I would recommend it to anyone especially if you enjoy a brew anytime of the day or night! How I ever survived the olden days where the first cup was the only good one in the pot? With the keurig every cup is the first cup!
review_title: How did I go this long without it?
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: JLP
review_text: I never knew my soul mate could be a coffee maker, but let me tell you this Keurig changes everything. I love the options, and it's super easy to use. I have plenty of K-Cups, but I also have a reusable K-Cup that I can fill with any brew of my choice. I use it for tea, hot cocoa, decaf, or just hot water if I have a tea bag instead. The inside is easy to clean, as the parts lift out, so no worries if you accidentally spill coffee grounds in the open chamber like I did.
review_title: My life is complete with this Keurig
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Jammer
review_text: Cute (my wife's description) and effective coffee maker.  It cleans up easy, you can dump the water if not in use for a while and it makes a good cup of coffee.  It has more options than the original Keurig and that has made everyone in the house happy.  Great upgrade, better look, worth the price.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Sarah
review_text: My boyfriend adored this! I know he wouldn t have spent the money himself but now that he has it every morning before work he makes himself a cup and I can tell it was the perfect gift! I have made good use out of it too haha :) Also, get yourself one of those reusable cups it will save you toons of money and it s much better than creating waste for the environment!
review_title: Got it for my boyfriend for Christmas!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Liana
review_text: Very happy with this.  We have many family members visit and my husband drinks decaf and not many family members do so having this helps with not having to make several pots of coffee.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: BohemianPassion
review_text: I love Keurig! I can't really give a thorough review as I got this for my son and future DIL for their shower.  But, they have told me that they are in love with it and have experienced no problems. The turquoise color is very pretty and matches their kitchen perfectly. I have a Keurig Vue...have had it for about 5 years and have never had any problems whatsoever.  I'm jealous of theirs...LOL...I see an upgrade coming soon. :-)
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Ray Dimaio
review_text: Very happy with the unit.  The only thing I did not like was that you have to load it with water from the rear.  Where I have it placed it takes a bit more effort.  Great coffee, No problems with the unit.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: JR
review_text: Overall disappointing.  Brewed coffee is not very hot; if fact, if you add milk you will most likely find your coffee only lukewarm.  Equally important, I have started to have problems within 4 months of purchase; the machine is leaking and not brewing correctly.  And the machine gets clogged easily, and it is not so easy to unclogged.  I would suggest you continue looking for a more reliable and a more capable coffee maker.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Animal lover
review_text: We've had several black Keurig coffee makers and love the coffee. But this little turquoise one is my favorite. It match our decor and also draws comments from kitchen visitors. So we love all Keurig products, but the color of this one has made it the best and most-loved.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Fran
review_text: This was my second Keurig.  I loved my first one, which was hit by lightning.  The new Keurig will not make hot chocolate.  The customer service rep said that the powder in the HC k-cups clogs up the machine.  My first Keurig made hot chocolate with no problem.  Is this a defect in the machine that I bought, or are all Keurigs made for coffee only?  If so, I wish I had known that before I purchased the second one.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Saluda Claude
review_text: Much better than the original model I purchased way back. Bravo, Keurig for the progress. Nice little machine.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Tracy P.
review_text: Love it! On my third Keurig and I ve loved them all. This color is spot on. If you re looking to give your kitchen a pop of color. The water is hot, as it should be. Always ready for the next brew, it s a great feature. I have a 16 oz mug and I pull out the tray, slide it in, select 10 oz, then brew another 4 (reusable coffee pods). Off to the car! Find a good mug like I did and you have hot coffee all morning.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Kindle Customer
review_text: Works great. Just remember if it starts dripping to take the k cup holder out and clean it. I was having a dripping issue and customer service walked me through removing the housing unit , which was easy, and the bottom tray was clogged. Works perfect again!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: mary
review_text: Our previous keurig died so we picked this.  It has a "carafe" option which we may try.  It is very different than our previous version so I'm still getting used to it.  No complaints I guess I need to read the directions on it.  Not sure if there is an auto on/off feature
review_title: Our previous keurig died so we picked this. It ...
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Pryor2013
review_text: Cute & convenient! Great price and awesome quality! Arrived quickly and exactly as described. The red colorway is brighter that what is shown in the images, which I was happy about!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: Bought this item as a Christmas gift. Works great for its purpose. Arrived with 2 day shipping just fine. But beware the box does come with the words Keurig on the outside for everyone to see. Included in box are cleaning supplies for the internals, 4 pack of coffee pods, the system itself, and instructions/manual. Giving 4 stars due to the fact that the box was labeled Keurig on outside and ruined a surprise.
review_title: Great product. Beware of shipping box.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: LoneStarChiver
review_text: Bought this as a gift for my mom over the holiday, she used it about 3 times before it started giving a message about being under pressure. Tried to clean it using the tools supplied and still nothing. After many attempts it at cleaning it started to work for about 2 uses and the same issue. The pods were definitely K cups because they are Keurig brand. Terrible Christmas present so I went out and bought her a new coffeemaker.
review_title: Terrible Christmas present so I went out and bought her ...
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: berombe
review_text: As a former French Press coffee person aficionado, this model Keurig is FABULOUS!  I use the Keurig filter because my coffee company does not make the K cups in my strength of coffee (French Market Dark Roast Coffee with Chicory).  I still have GREAT coffee after changing from my French Press to this Keurig.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: KDBUG
review_text: Wow, I absolutely love this machine. Quiet but it does make sound. It is more compact in comparison to my older model. I love the colors as well. The pearl matches my cabinets. No problems so far but we all know nothing last forever.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Jane S Rodriguez
review_text: Some one opened the outer box, looked at it, and shipped it back. Everything inside the innerbox was still packed and wrapped from the manufacturer. I love the pearl color. I always buy used from Amazon when I can with very few regrets. Keurigs usually last for 2-3 years with daily use for me.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: MICHELLE ROSAS
review_text: This is my second Keurig as my 1st one went into my Rv. I couldn't decide which one to get and saw some not so good reviews on this one but decided to take a chance. The price was good and decided to purchase the extra warranty in case i have issues like others did. It isnt noisy like some people mentioned, it doesnt take forever to heat up either. Brewed my 1st cup this morning and was nice and hot maybe not as hot as my other one but used a Yeti and it stayed warm. If anything changes i will post
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Melanie Yardley
review_text: I love this Keurig model!  Push screen is easy to navigate.  I love that it is more streamline than the older models with the water reservoir on the side.  Takes up less counter space and performs so many useful functions.  Strong coffee, different size cups, even makes a carafe of coffee!  Great purchase!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: mamacat
review_text: Not worth it-  my K-10 is going on 4yrs. old and while not perfect, it's been reliable and pretty decent, but I figured it was coming due for a replacement.
