I liked the sound of the K250 so ordered it, it looks nice and was pretty easy to set up and technically works, however after using it the first couple times on 8oz. all I got was 1/2 a cup, I tried 10 (which is what I use on my K-10) and barely got more than a 1/2 cup.  In addition the coffee comes out barely hot and weak even on the strong setting.  The water comes through the machine way too fast for this to even have a chance to really draw out any flavor at all- my K-10 makes a better/hotter cup of coffee.  I wanted to give this a chance for a few days, but each cup is the same, so it's going back.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: mary braun
review_text: This is a beautiful brewer, but I feel like I've brewed more cleansing brews than actual cups of coffee. It  displays more messages than my iPhone.  Sorry, interrupted, call keurig, call 911.  And, it's less than a week old. I wish I'd never thrown the box away.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Kyle Dethomas
review_text: I ordered this new and instead it came missing parts and did not work; it would not brew one cup of coffee.  When I called Keurig for help, I discovered it was registered in someone else's name.  Extremely disappointing.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Bill
review_text: We had an older one and it went bad after many years of use. Wife liked this one, it is a smaller size for down stairs. She likes a cup of tea at night, and I have a coffee in the am. We don't like the fact you can't use any k-cup in it, It will only Keurig k-cups, unless you mod it. After that they all work fine.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Ashley Roy
review_text: I strongly suggest reading the reviews carefully before choosing which Keurig to buy. I just received this one today and it s stuck on this screen even though the shipping disc was removed. I tried looking online for answers, but there is nothing that can be done except getting a new one. I will not purchase this model of Keurig again.
review_title: Really upset that it s not working properly
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: babidoll2185
review_text: I've thought about purchasing a Keurig for over a year now, but couldn't justify the price. However, I have no problem spending $5.00 a day on coffee. I finally decided to "splurge" and I'm so happy that I did! I save a ton of money now and it doesn't take very long to make a cup of coffee! I haven't had any issues using off brand k-cups either.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Andrea
review_text: This is a big improvement over earlier models of the Keurig coffee maker. It has a small touch screen with easy operating indicators. It is compact and pretty too. The only shortcoming is that it is a bit hard to reattach the water reservoir without spilling water, but overall, it is excellent.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Meraki1346
review_text: I looooove my keurig.  This is my secind keurig. I lobe the color.  I love that this version is easier to clean. My only complaint is this was the same price as my old keurig.  The old version had a clock and a timer.
review_title: I love that this version is easier to clean
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: KC
review_text: Gave 3 star because of the sensor in the lid requiring to use ONLY Keurig cups. There are hacks to overcome this. However Keurig should have known better. Also the water container is small, need to refill after 3 to 4 cups. I do like the speed and various cup size fill rate.
review_title: ONLY Keurig cups. There are hacks to overcome........
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Red
review_text: No auto shut off (whch would have been nice).  Drip tray falls away from machine when you move it!  I had a mini and truly like it better.  It just dispensed good coffee - This one meh.........for the price difference not worth it!  Next time I purchase one I am done with Keurig.  They are charging more and giving you less.
review_title: I had a mini and truly like it better
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Mallory Foy
review_text: All coffee made had a very plastic taste to it. Tried about ten cups before giving up and returning to exchange for a different model. Also, the water tank being on the back was inconvenient and awkward to refill as it was under kitchen cabinets on the counter. upgraded to a model that has a large side tank.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: DV-CPA
review_text: It's a Keurig, it works fine, and has a nice compact size.  But on two occasions I've noticed green slime growing in the bottom of the water receptacle.  Fortunately, it's easy to clean.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: ebony cavanaugh
review_text: i bought this as a christmas gift and it was a hit. My sister loves it. she set it up immedialty and uses it everyday. she moved the other one off the counter and said she is donating it.
review_title: great buy is a hit in my household
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

review_text: OK MUST FILL UP EVERY CUP TAKES A WHILE TO HEAT
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

review_text: okay. I love that it's turquoise. the first one had to be returned, but this one works fine. The cup sizes are nice and my husband says that the lighter or darker doesn't do that much. He's the coffee man so I'll take his word.
review_title: Very nice keurig and Great Color
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Islander
review_text: Original Keurig was at least 6 years old and served us well.  This unit looks sleek and really like the smaller size.  Need to fill the water a bit more frequently, but it fits under the countertop and works great.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Chris B.
review_text: Pros:
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Lisa M
review_text: This is absolutely amazing and wish I got this sooner. Its been 5years between this an my last keurig.I love the filter option now. I like the option of the cup sizes on the touch screen. Very nice so far.
review_title: Made this!!!! Touch of a button!!!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: C.M.W.
review_text: No matter how many times I washed and rinsed and vinegar treated the coffee maker, there remained a very pronounced plastic taste and smell to the output water / coffee.  I see online that many have experienced the same problem.  After six cycles the smell remains....one person said I haven t cycled it enough...in my view, I shouldn t have to do it more than once when it s brand new.....returned for full credit...thank you Amazon Prime!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Hayley Oliveira
review_text: So simple and easy to use! great purchase and perfect for a tiny dorm or small house. The temperature of the coffee is great to sip black, i can see how someone adding milk would make it much cooler, but for me it is not an issue.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Joanna Jones
review_text: I have owned several Keurigs throughout these years.  Through Amazon, I ordered the red one....see my last purchase.  BUT, THE HEATING ELEMENT IS VERY, VERY. WEAK AND I END UP HEATING THE COFFEE IN THE MICROWAVE.  I SHOULD NOT HAVE TO DO THAT AT ALL!  In 2012 I purchased a Keurig from COSTCO as a gift for my brother while visiting in California.  Have been in CA the last 5 weeks and this Keurig delivers a very nice hot cup of coffee.  What seems to be the problem??????  Not pleased w/my most recent purchase from Amazon!
review_title: Have been in CA the last 5 weeks and this Keurig delivers a very nice hot cup of coffee
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Amanda M
review_text: I love this coffee maker. The color is great, and the quality is good. The only thing I don't like is that it will not allow you to use pods from any company; they must all come from Keurig.  I ended up buying the freedom clip to work around that issue. Since then, I have had no problems.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Josef Green
review_text: This bad boy right here is the business!
review_title: This bad boy right here is the business

name: brenda
review_text: Works great but kind of a bummer that only Keurig pods can be used and if you want to make a large mug you have to buy the K-Carafe and pods. I just make two cups of coffee to fill my travel mug to compensate for that intentional glitch with the product.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: Although this unit sounds more mechanical than our older unit. I just wonder if we will get the 4 yrs we had on the older unit. So far it pumps out a great brew!  Dislike- pumping sound/ and off touch button on screen in far lower right corner of the screen.  Likes- Wife like the color!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

review_text: I have owned this for a couple of weeks and I am returning it because the unit stopped working.  Cheaply made in comparison to my old Keurig.  I just returned another brand that didn't work right out if the box.  Does anyone make a decent brewer anymore?
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: It's good, but after for cups of coffee you have to refill it with water. It does not fit any of the items from the store that are made for Keurg, such as the reusable coffee filter of the large mug. But still it makes my coffee super fast. Sometimes to fast and I am drinking much more.
review_title: It's good, but after for cups of coffee you have ...
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: M. Griffin
review_text: Had it a week and the icon to turn it off doesn't work.
review_title: The color is very pretty shade of blue
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Leigh P.
review_text: Nice machine that works well. Makes something of a pumping sound which was different than the other one that finally gave up the ghost. One criticism is that the auto off feature is gone so if  you forget to turn it off your dinero will be gone as well!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: BrooklynMcIntosh
review_text: I use my Keurig everyday. When my daughter went off to college I purchased this one for her dorm room. Love the color! She loves that she can use it for hot water - hello top ramen, tea and hot chocolate, in addition to coffee.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: J. Denhart
review_text: Like the size, color, makes good coffee.  Like the preheated feature.
review_title: Keurig single serve really is a single serve!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: I now have two Keurigs.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: wizin2k1
review_text: I just recently started drinking coffee and i gotta ssy this machine is great. I dunno how to make any coffee but this thing you put your pod and your ready to go. If you need a small cup or a mug w.e great machine to have for ppl on the go. Good for other things like tea, chocolate, oatmeal instant hot water.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: This is the worst Keurig I've ever owned!  A "Brew Interrupted" message constantly comes up on the screen--even after I have used the little pod that was included to clean the needle.  I've never had to clean a needle before, and now I have to do it twice a week to not have the brew interrupted or grounds in my coffee!  I am torn between trying to find a better brewer or going back to a regular coffee maker!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: mw
review_text: I love this guy.  It's an adorable teal color, it makes such good coffee super fast, and it's just the best.  It was time t upgrade from our worn-out last Keurig, 1.0, and we bought this 2.0 and couldn't be happier.  Have had it a couple of months now and just love it.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: TN MT Mama
review_text: I saw this color at a local store and they were out so I ordered via Amazon. OMG! It brightens up a very dark kitchen. I had no idea it had a touch screen and so many options. It tells me what to do no matter how sleepy I am in the mornings. LOVE IT!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Hyundai owner
review_text: This smaller Keuirg does everything my old model did and tales less space on my kitchen counter.  Great coffee maker at a cost effective price point.  Color goes well in our kitchen and my spouse loves the color and size.
review_title: Great coffee maker at a cost effective price point
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Bbeadin
review_text: This machine has been a real trial! Finally after contacting Keurig, I found out when you load the k cup, push in, it will snap in place, all problems gone! Perfect coffee every time, yeah keurig!!!!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: I have wasted so much time on trying to get this product to work. I have set it up correctly and when i go to use it all it keeps telling me is...preheating and then to lift handle. Once i do that and it says to place the handle down I do so and it starts all over again. I wasted 30 minutes this morning just trying to have a cup of coffee. I'll be waiting to hear a response on trying to fix the issue today and if not I will be returning this item.
review_title: I have wasted so much time on trying to get this product ...
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Evette A.
review_text: Purchased this for my daughter. She loves the color, size, functionality and programmability! Great little coffee maker.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Ms.Mystery
review_text: Worked well for a few weeks but now the grounds jam up about every third time...a real pain AND a waste of expensive K cups. Keurig KNOWS about this problem because they include a little orange plastic grounds clearer,,,NOT what you want to do when thinking you're getting your first cup of coffee. Beware.  What's happened to Keurig quality?????
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: kyle mcclay
review_text: Love my new keurig! And the color is awesome!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: D. Lange
review_text: Bought this to replace our previous model. Works great, the coffee is hot, and it has an option to make the coffee stronger. The turquoise color is beautiful and retro. It has a much smaller footprint than our old one, so more room on the counter.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Thomas Bachner
review_text: Really wish I could still return this unit, very unhappy with the design. First off the water tank is awkward to fill, we have elected to use a decanter to fill instead of removing. Next, there is no auto-off setting which means it sits there powered until someone notices and manually turns it off. Finally, the most irritating part is that you have to close it to prepare then open/close it again to brew. On the whole, it is a terrible design and I should have paid closer attention to other's negative reviews.
review_title: Very poor design, look at other units.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: This is the third Keurig I have purchased within the last 9 months. The first 2 were less expensive, so I upgraded to a higher costly model & made the purchase through Amazon. The first 2 had been purchased through a dept store and since I've always had good luck with Amazon, I purchased the third. Now the third has died, ergo I will NOT be purchasing another Keurig!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: TeknoTools
review_text: We gave this to our niece as a Christmas gift to use in her dorm room. She wanted a coffee pot, but we gave her this Keurig due to it's ease of use, sleek/compact design, and total flexibility. Although it's a 2.0 model, it uses non-Keurig brand coffee pods to make single cups, pots with the add-on Keurig carafe, or the add-on travel mug. It's actually quieter than our Breville 1.0 single serve when it's heating up water and dispensing hot drinks.
review_title: We gave this to our niece as a Christmas gift ...
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Joe P
review_text: Works great . The water resivour is poorly designed. Hard to fill if it's under a cabinet . Resivour lid is also difficult to get back on. Have had a few of these this is definitely my least favorite
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: NO-NWO.
review_text: This is a Malayasia built Keurig. Inferior in every way. Could not get plastic taste out. Turns out after talking with Keurig "It happens on some units". This after swallowing half a cup of who knows what. Tried with different water, k cups but machine was no good. Also, slide in tray did not stay.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Sara A. Helsley
review_text: I have had this for over a year and it works perfectly!  Some of the other reviews mentioned it is loud when preheating, etc.  It is audible, yes, but it doesn't wake the baby or anything.  :)  Coffee, chai and hot chocolate always come out the perfect temp.  I don't drink a cup every day, but close... and I haven't had any issues.  Easy to clean, when needed.  Would definitely recommend.
review_title: chai and hot chocolate always come out the perfect temp. I don't drink a cup every day
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: EC
review_text: Ordered this to replace my 10 year old Mini. When I was setting it up, the unit wouldn t recognize that there was water in the reservoir. I called Keurig customer service and they said that my tap water must be too pure (?) in my area and the unit isn t reading it. I would have to use bottled water instead, which isn t feasible. I find it extremely hard to believe that my unfiltered tap water is more pure than bottled water, but left with no option, I m returning the unit and will go with another brand. Very disappointing.
review_title: Ordered this to replace my 10 year old Mini. ...
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Heather
review_text: **Edit- They are sending me a replacement coffee maker, I will update again as soon as I have it. Added 2 stars for costumer service**

review_text: Love this coffee maker.  Can pick size as well as strength.

review_text: Now we have a San Francisco coffee shop in Pueblo Colorado right in our kitchen. Not every coffee is excellent but there are varieties and experiences with each one. Most are so superb that I think I'm back in San Francisco.

product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

review_text: Always wanted one....., finally broke down and bought one.  This Model is perfect for my use.  I have it in my master bath so I can have that cup of coffee whenever the urge strikes me....., 24/7.  Love it.

review_text: The only change I d make is to have a hinged lid on the water tank so you don t have to take the lid completely off each time. It makes a great cup of coffee! Love the size and strength settings and how fast it is. The color is great too.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

review_text: Coffee and water dispensed tasted and smelt like burnt plastic! Read online other users have had this problem, tried cleaning out the system by running vinegar through it, tried flushing the system multiple times. Still, the taste was there! Returning for a full refund.

name: S. Pace
review_text: I have a Keurig K 55 for the home, got it for my birthday about 2 years ago and it's still going strong.  So, I bought this red Keuric K250 for the camper, because I love my home Keurig.  Easy and simple to use, but I didn't wan't to have to fill the thing with water for each cup, I wanted a bit larger model.  I thought because of the design and being a 40 ounce instead of 48 it would be smaller than my K 55, but it's actually a little taller, but less wide.  I bought the carafe to go with it, but the local stores only carry the donut shop regular, that's including WalMart, and I can't see buying a four pack for $20 here on Amazon, so I will probably not be using the carafe.  We have a couple friends who drink coffee, and if you could brew a big potful that would be perfect, but it only holds up to 30 oz, which is two big mugfuls and a dribble anyway, so I feel the carafe is useless.  No silly 6 ounce mugs at my house!  Also, you can't use a huge mug with that carafe feature, (we like strong coffee) cause there is a sensor in the base that unless you have a Keurig carafe it won't show the carafe brew feature.  Keurig does not sell a carafe size pod to use your own coffee, either, and the after market reusable pods you can get necessitate having to put a couple pieces up in the head of the coffeemaker and they quit working after one pot.  So basically the carafe feature is useless to me.  It brews regular pods just fine, so four stars for that, knocking off one star for the poor carafe feature.  Keurig, you have lots of fans out there, let's not get greedy putting expensive sensor features on your machines to try and keep your exclusivity, that's just being silly, it's just a coffee pot after all is said and done, not rocket tech!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Mark A. Wuebben
review_text: ditto on all the comments here regarding low quality.  its cheap plastic - made in china so don't expect much.  I don't know where they get off charging so much.  This is our third machine - the other two died, one in 11 months.  Even though its brand new, the pump already makes sounds like it is struggling and old.  We previously had larger machines.  This is smaller and takes up less shelf space which is a positive.  The water container is somewhat awkward and must be pushed and maneuvered to get it tightly into place.  Once in, just leave it and take off the top cover to add water.  Unlike earlier machines it does not have a algae/mold inducing green light in the water container.  However, to add water, which you must do frequently because of the small tank, you need to move the whole machine.  All that said, there is not much choice and if you like K-pods, it works.  This is for my wife as I use french press so the smaller unit does the job for 1-2 users.  As others have mentioned, don't expect HOT beverages.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

review_text: One rule that I live by is that I only drink one cup of coffee a day and that cup has to be a good.  You can imagine the dissappment I felt when my trusted Farberware percolator died. name: F. Martin
review_text: The first thing you need to know about this machine is it has Digital Rights Management for the coffee pods. You can't use it with non-Keurig coffee pods, and you can't use it with older Keurig pods. The machine scans the top of the pod, and if it doesn't find its code on the pod, it won't brew the coffee. I wish I'd know this before I purchased it. I should have researched more. The machine came with four pods. Unfortunately, they were the older coffee pods, so they wouldn't work with the machine. Thankfully, when I purchased this, I purchased a reusable Keurig approved cup so we can use Folgers if we want.  I am not a coffee drinker. I purchased this for my husband for his birthday. He says the coffee it makes is really hot (which is exactly how he likes it), so he's happy with that. We are still learning to use the machine, so maybe it has other redeeming qualities. But had I known about the DRM for the coffee, that would have been a deal breaker and I wouldn't have purchased this machine.
review_title: Warning -- Machine has Digital Rights Management for Coffee Pods
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: M. Long
review_text: My "old" Keurig was 10x better than this pre-programmed piece of junk.  I could use a pod where I could pack in my own coffee - I could select travel size (12oz-16oz) size if I wanted, etc. This forces you to "buy their pods" - you cannot set it to larger sizes for travel mugs, it's pre-set for 8oz, period!  Also, when you try to brew your own - no way.  It has "modes" that are pre-programmed by the size/type of pod you put in it, so you have to buy "k-cups, k-mug, and k-carafe" different types if you want to brew larger amounts.  I'm going back to my old one (I just typically ran it through twice at 12oz, we like weak coffee), and sell this one (hopefully) in a yard sale.  No more Keurig, next time, a regular drip coffee maker!  What a racket they have!!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Cristina Grecu
review_text: It works OK with the reusable filter that I purchased separately, but except the first two times it does not work with Keurig Kcups. Every time I try to use the Kcup it is giving me the same message "water under pressure" and that I might need to clean the needle. As soon as I switch back to the reusable filter it works perfectly fine (so, there is no clogged needle or anything). I've already thrown away 6 Kcups trying, same message every time. What a big disappointment ! I had stocked up on Kcup pods and now I am unable to use them. I hope someone from the company is reading this and reaches out with a solution, it is probably a common issue, otherwise will return.

name: Kschles
review_text: I tried Keurig machine a couple of times in the past. Always had trouble getting a strong cup of coffee...even with using bold k cups at a 6 oz setting. Have been grinding my own beans and using a good drip machine for quite awhile, but this does take time, especially in the mornings when one is not fully awake. Thought I d give Keurig another shot. The first K250 I got from Amazon had a big problem...while the coffee was much stronger because of the new pulse brewing option (even at 8 oz), the coffee tasted of plastic. Quick googling showed others had this problem. Even after running about 20 cycles of hot water through the machine, the problem remained. Got rid of the machine. Kept thinking about it, however. Except for the plastic taste problem, found the K250 to be pretty impressive. Looking at all the reviews on Amazon and elsewhere, most didn t have this problem. Decided to try again. This time I got a good machine. No plastic taste from the get go. The coffee is strong enough for me using a variety of K cups. Pulse brewing seems to make all the difference. Only make 2-3 cups a day, so the size of the water tank is fine. Like the size of the K250.  Looked at more expensive 2.0 machines, but didn t see any features I had to have. Giving this a 4 Star review based on problems with my first K250,as well as concerns about long term viability (been using it about a month now). So far things are going well.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Sarah
review_text: This is my third Keurig. The first two were the same Mr. Coffee model that I bought because they were $80 while any Keurig built brewers were $120 or more. At least the Mr. Coffee models worked for a little while. Eventually, though, both of them stopped brewing full cups and I started getting a lot of grounds in each cup. After a bout with customer service who said I was doing something wrong, I just stopped brewing coffee at home for awhile. I was really skeptical about spending yet another chunk of change on yet another coffee maker but I really missed coffee in the morning so I bought this one. Straight out of the box, it has never ever brewed a full 10 oz cup. When I contacted Keurig they said I might need to descale or I should try this, this, or this... But it didn't work Out Of The Box guys. Right now I'm just hitting brew twice which defeats the purpose of pressing a button, walking away, and coming back in a couple minutes knowing that your coffee is done. But it's still better than not having coffee in the morning. I might go back to the good old $25 regular coffee brewers that lasted 10 years at a time whenever this one truly keels over. I expect it might be soon.
review_title: Never Met A Keurig I Liked
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

review_text: Seems to work well. After having some troubles with our original keurig, I bought this one. It is a lot more convenient because of the water reservoir and I like that it has a filter. Takes a few minutes from start to coffee but I can't imagine being that impatient that it would a problem. The display is nice and lets you pick different amounts and also if you want to make the coffee stronger. The only negative is that it was slightly cumbersome to get it put together and going but after it was complete there were no problems. Well recommended if you need something to brew k-cups.

review_text: It is perfect for two people. I did not want a large tank in which the water would sit for days before it is used. We get around 3-4 cups without having to add more water, on this model. name: DPCTEXAS
review_text: We liked our Keurig so much that we decided to get a new one since our old one started to make some sounds like it was on it's last leg. We researched a lot of Keurigs and decided on this one. You know what they say when you have a good product you don't mess with it! Well, Keurig never heard that, because they designed this one and we had to return the first one and now we have to return the second one because they don't work the way they are suppose too. If you have a large cup like us, it takes two cycles to fill it and the machine never ends the first cycle before it starts the second cycle or it will end the first cycle and you get a continous error before you can start the second cycle. I can't recommend this too anyone. The worst Keurig ever.

name: Crystal D
review_text: I have had this for a few day, so far so good. It is replacing my Starbucks Verismo brewer because those pods are getting expensive. I bought the espresso Keurig pods and brew the night before, refrigerate and use for iced machiattos the next morning.  You can select up to 10oz coffee with the regular pods. Just make sure you get 2.0 pods. it's easy to use and not too noisy.  This one has a filter, which I haven't used in a keurig before-I have an older one at my office. But you soak in water for 5 min and rinse for 1 and you're good for 6 months. I can't tell the difference using it and not ( I brewed the first cup without it).

name: karen rolfs
review_text: I have had a number of issues which keeps me from being thrilled with this product.  Got the 30 kpod mix to try out different types of brews and have been so disappointed.  Four of them would not work in the brewer with not made for keurig message on screen,  before I was near 1/2 way thru the 30!  Some of the coffees were so bitter and not even drinkable at all.  The instructions received with use manual are incomplete and I ended up calling Keurig to get the information by phone with a somewhat less than knowledgeable person.  Information on filters was very poor to nonexistent.  To top off the insult,  the last email I received from you offered the product ,  very same one I just bought,  for $25 less than I have already paid.  Still experimenting with taste but at this rate not sure I will keep it and then will likely have to pay to return it. Not a happy camper at this point for sure after so looking forward to something that would quickly give me a delicious choice of brews and minimal  amount of effort each day.

review_text: I would give this a 5 star, as it works as expected, but I am very annoyed that you cannot load your coffee pod, place your cup under the drip, set the fill amount, push brew and walk away. Instead, you must wait for it to preheat the water, then you can adjust your settings for the brew. This doesn't seem like a big issue, but when you are in a hurry and want to grab you lunch and put on your shoes/coat and come back in a minute or two while your coffee brews, it eliminates the option because you have to sit there and watch it preheat.

name: Chewie
review_text: Horrible machine.  Our old one lasted quite a while, for years in fact.  It finally failed.  I was so impressed, I bought this "upgraded" 2.0 model.  What a hunk of junk.  It recently became clogged.  I used the needle cleaning valve to dislodge grounds.  Ever since it has needed it more and more often.  Today, I made many, many, oh so many attempts at cleaning the needle.  I finally gave up when it spewed hot water and grounds all over me.  In a moment of frustration I finally thought I'd take the piece  garbage out and "vent" a little.  See attached pic.  I doubt Kuerig reads these things.  I am donating my remaining K Cups.  I will go back to the more friendly, longer lasting, Mr Coffee.  I hope you wake up and smell the coffee and take these off the market and improve the quality of your machines.
review_title: Kuerig: Wake up and smell the coffee.  Horrible Machine.

review_text: I did a lot of research before selecting this product. The best Keurig!  Arrived in a timely fashion and well packaged. Extremely easy to set up and use. I use Caza Trail products at https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00F9XU83M/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o06_s03?ie=UTF8&th=1.  I also purchased the "Keurig 2.0 K-Carafe Reusable Coffee Filter and Single Refillable K-Cup 4 piece Bundle Gift Set with Coffee Scoop for K200, K300, K400 and K500 series'" at https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0182X5UFG/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o00_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1. name: Momof3
review_text: I have a fix! I wanted to let people know that the trouble with the needle maintenance happened to me within the first few days of using the machine. This happens because the stuff inside the kcup gets globbed up around the needle when water starts going through it. I have figured out by simply leaning the kcup back before inserting it to make all the stuff inside go toward the back and very slowly placing the cup in and lowering the handle so it doesn't all fall forward can help. Also sometimes I lift the handle again and poke multiple holes in the cup like 3 or just unplug and plug in again that resets it. One of these always seems to do the trick! Love my machine now!
review_title: Easy solution for needle maintenance problem

review_text: This my 3rd Keurig - two from Costco and last one from Amazon. It's not the vendor. Its the Keurig product.  If something doesn't work after  6-8 months using daily for( 3) 6 0z cups or 18 ounces @ day, Keurig tells you to disassemble products, descale, clean, use filtered water, fill a bulb, and push 7x.....whatever. If that doesn't work SEND coffee maker back to Keurig - at your expense. Keurig will send a___?___ per cent off to purchase another unit. I declined.I still would be losing money. I returned coffee maker #1 to Costco and Costco accepted the unit w/o any questions.  Purchased #3 as a gift.  I refuse to pay $150+ for a product, become a coffee maker technician, return at my expense and receive a coupon to purchase another coffer maker. This does not include the K-Cups (some don't work with certain Keurigs), accessories, water filters, etc.  Returning to drip coffee makers. Little can go wrong.

name: Ilovemydogs
review_text: This is by far the worst Keurig model I ve owned.  Over the years I have had four different models at home and work. I bought this K250  to upgrade my K 55 at home. I liked the design- that it had a large reservoir in the back. I also liked the digital screen, and the color gray.  However,  like some of their other new models, the rigid top handle and stationary bottom cupholder do not move smoothly. It feels very cheap and plastic. I also get a water pressure error on about one out of every 5 cups. It wastes the k cup and  also often creates a mess removing it.  Because of those factors, it is the worst of the four models I have owned. I do know others with the same model and they are having similar issues. I have tried all the steps of cleaning and because I have had it for more than 90 days, I m not sure if I will attempt to return. I have actually brought out my old machine for now. All in all, the design looks nice but that s where it ends.
review_title: Of 4, the  worst Keurig model I ve ever owned!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: D
review_text: Yes this thing is pretty, but do not buy it. I've had so much trouble with this thing, especially with the needle saying it has been interrupted or whatever. It's so annoying. It works most of the time yes but when it doesn't I'm ready to throw it out the window, becuase when it's the morning and you're barely awake, you don't want to be having trouble  with the thing that keeps you alive. Honestly, I had no trouble with a little hamilton brew one cup maker, and if I hadn't of spent my life's savings on this piece of crap, I would keep using it. Also, if you're using coffee grounds, it doesn't work too well. It shoves all the coffee out the way to the sides of the cup and you just get water. K-cups work better, but that is when the needle interruption happens. Just don't buy this piece of crap. Do some research.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Susan C.
review_text: Wish I could give this coffee maker a 0! DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY on this or any other new Keurig. I received this for Christmas and the plastic taste was so strong I could not drink the coffee. I ran vinegar through it over and over with no luck. I checked on Keurig reviews and many people are having this problem. Keurig started using a cheaper plastic and you CANNOT get the taste out. I called Keurig customer service and the guy told me he had heard if you run lemon juice through it, that will help. Are you kidding me!!! I told him you shouldn t have to spend that much money on a Keurig and then have to fix it before you can use it. I called back the next day and talked to a lady that seemed really helpful. She did end up sending me a brand new Keurig if I would send them back the k cup holder (to prove I really had the coffee maker) in a special envelope and of course I had to pay for the envelope and the postage. I asked her what if the new pot has the same taste .... well guess what. I cannot drink the coffee because of the plastic taste and I have to wonder if it isn t toxic. Order at your own risk.
review_title: DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY on this or any other new Keurig
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: I got this as a gift and I loved it. One issue I noticed right off was that it would drip coffee longer than necessary once it said it was done brewing. This was messy and a bit annoying but not a big deal. Then my coffee started tasting off. I even went so far as to try my K-cups on someone else's Keurig to see if I was remembering them wrong. Nope. Mine had a very strong flavor of burnt plastic. I tried cleaning my machine about 4 times with vinegar, which is what they recommend you do. It did nothing. You have to have proof of purchase to use the warranty, which I don't, because it was a gift. Seems like a waste to have to get rid of it but the taste is intolerable
review_title: I got this as a gift and I loved it. One issue I noticed right off was ...
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: J. Lockemeyer
review_text: This is a great machine - Ive had really expensive machines - which eventually wore out and bought this Keurig. It cost me approx $115 back in 2015 (on black friday) and they are similarly priced now, so they haven't gone down too much.  I was buying another one for a gift and saw all the negative reviews and was shocked.  Ive had mine (as I mentioned for 2 years), and brew approx 20 cups a week.  I buy the K-cups from Amazon subscribe and save program (K-cups come each month), and got a frother and make my own latte's every single day for about 50 cents. Its really a fabulous machine and works way better than my more expensive high-end latte/espresso machine (which was $250 back in 2002). Ive cleaned it with vinegar twice and had to clean the needle (there is a pokey thing inside the machine that can get clogged when poking through the k-cup foil (and/or grounds) at the top -  Ive cleaned that 3 times in 2 years.  Not a big deal considering that a regular coffee maker you have certain things you have to do to clean it , etc.  Would I recommend it - Absolutely.  Its a fabulous machine and Im happy to pay for their great invention and have it in my kitchen.  Also - I can make "espresso" in it - there are K-cups from Brooklyn Coffee that are called "express-o" and although the lowest ounce size cup is 4oz - it still tastes like espresso.  I also make iced coffee -(iced lattes too) - its really great.
review_title: Terrific Coffee at an affordable price
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: siam
review_text: My wife bought the k250 for my birthday a couple weeks before Christmas, I had to cut down on my coffee intake due too doctors orders, I had a bunn coffee maker, but you have to make a 3 cup minimum. The keuig is the perfect machine for our use. I have one cup in the morning and one after work, my wife isn t a coffee drinker, she likes hot cocoa, we bought the 250 because you can use the k mug pods and bought the carafe as well for when we have company and we have the reusable filter too, but haven t used it since I discovered the green mountain dark magic pods. We have had no trouble with this machine,heats and works perfectly, so we have had the machine about 3 months,easy to clean, there s some great videos on YouTube one how to take care of and clean the machine, which I think most people neglect, we always use filtered water. I have heard some people complain about not having a auto shut off. I don t see tha as a problem, it doesn t continually heat. I always shut off when done.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: T. Benedict
review_text: Bought for my husband for Christmas, but after less than a year, I m sick of it. I thought that the pods were more recyclable. I got one of the doodads that cuts the plastic cup so I can tear out the coffee and filter for compost and separate out the aluminum lid. It s ridiculously cumbersome to do, it s messy, and the rest of it   the plastic pod and ring aren t recyclable. I got it to eliminate mess, but it s worse than ever. So I got a couple of the individual pods to fill with coffee, but that s a hassle every night, and I still have to deal with knocking the grounds out for compost, which is seriously messy.
review_title: Meh coffee and environmentally awful pods.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Miranda
review_text: We love this! We just received off of our Amazon Wedding Registry and I gotta say... I was anti-Keurig for a long time but since they're making more recyclable kcups I let my fiancee add it to the list. I'm SO glad he did! First off, I think this model is perfect for a 2-3 person household. You can get probably 3 brews out of a full water reservoir. However, this model is also compatible with the Keurig Karafe so if you're entertaining and want to make more of the same brew, it can do that too which really appealed to me. I like the slim front-facing design as it doesn't take up a lot of counter space. We got Peacock Blue which is really pretty and adds a pop of color to the kitchen. We've been brewing Great Value brand pods from Walmart and they come out perfect every time. Also, as people have stated, this came with a water filter kit (though we just fill our reservoir with pre-filtered water, so we don't use it), a cleansing solution, and 4 sample pods. Great little starter pack for the Keurig beginner!
review_title: Didn't Want It, Glad We Have It!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Valerie
review_text: When one purchases a coffee maker, one wants it to reliably make coffee. Within every single pack of pods I buy, 2-4 pods do not successfully make a cup of coffee. It either stalls half way through, or the entire cup is swimming in grounds, which is not awesome. I really wanted to love this machine, but after almost a year's worth of very frustrating ownership, having to make many cups in my French press instead, I cannot recommend anyone waste this kind of money on such an inferior machine. I kept up with the required maintenance, used only approved pods (after having to throw out so many of my old ones as they are not compatible), and the only thing the damn maker brews is sadness in the morning. Not a good way to start the day.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: MysticMerGirl
review_text: I bought this on sale at Kohl's during Thanksgiving week and stacked 3 coupon codes. My total was $68.42. I couldn't believe it as I've been looking for a Keurig for quite some time but the high prices of the machines plus added costs of the cups just didn't seem worth it to me. I also was reading a lot of bad reviews on the 2.0 models so that was another reason for waiting. I have to say I'm impressed so far with what this machine has to offer. I've used it almost everyday since making coffee, hot chocolate and adding just hot water for my quick instant soups which I love! I made a video of the machine working which I will be adding shortly showing you the features, how it works, how long it took to heat up (they say approximately 3 minutes but only took about 1.5-2 minutes). The actual brew size that comes out vs what you choose (the very first time it brewed less than it was supposed to, but has been right on target since). My package came with the coffee machine (I bought in Plum Gray-LOVE THE COLOR), sample pack of 4 keurig cups (Swiss Miss Hot Chocolate, Donut Shop, Green Mountain and I believe a Maxwell House-will update if necessary when I post video and pics). It also came with 2 extra water filter/cartridges, a bottle of Drs along solution and finally the orange cleaner took that Keurig now puts in all boxes to help keep the needles clean and unclogged) ***If you have an older machine or your box came without one you can call Keurig and they will send you one for free for a limited time)*** The digital display is very nice, large enough to read without any issues and machine itself was very simple to set up. Please check back shortly as I will be posting more specifics, pictures and videos for this model, The Keurig 2.0 K250. Thanks for reading
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: PetiteRN
review_text: I purchased the single Keurig to replace another that was old. I liked the idea that when company came, we could attach the Keurig carafe and with one K-Carafe pod, make 4 cups of coffee in one brew. You can only engage the larger capactity brew once the K-carafe pod is installed. The carafe only kept the coffee warm maybe 20 minutes. If you are using the single serve only, it will brew just fine. We drink at least two cups of coffee and I think I would have been happier with a larger reservoir. I feel like we are constantly adding water to this. Plus, you have to buy separate filters to add to your water reservoir (I found generic ones for way cheaper and in bulk). If you are like me and like to run vinegar through your machine...DON'T BUY THIS MACHINE. I ran vinegar through, another reservoir of water, changed the filter, and still had to run through two more reservoirs of water/brew to get the vinegar out of the machine because it kept curdling my cream. I've always used vinegar to clean...so now I guess I'll have to buy Keurig's machine cleaner :(
review_title: I would NOT buy this product again
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: jS
review_text: We have owned a Keurig system for many years and this K250 is the worst of the bunch.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: mjsmom05
review_text: This coffee maker ended my relationship with Keurig/Green Mountain Coffee.  We had been using this brand happily for several years.  Then our old B60 Special Edition finally stopped working and we decided to purchase this one.  The "special" reusable coffee filters worked for a while until we started having issues with the LCD display.  I looked on YouTube how to fix the LCD issue.  Once I did that, the non-Keurig reusable filters would no longer work.  I really dislike the company trying to force its customers into using their brand of K-Cups.  As a result, we trashed this one and purchased the Hamilton Beach 49980A Single Serve Coffee Brewer and Full Pot Coffee Maker, 2-Way as a replacement.  Much cheaper and itt does not need "special" K-Cups to work.  We can use whatever kind of coffee we want.  Bye bye Keurig.
review_title: We had been using this brand happily for several years
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: mizzouXC
review_text: Most of my friends are LDS (mormon). This is my sin machine as they call it. They eye it suspiciously every time they visit my house. This is almost as bad as playing "hide the liquor" with my baptist parents. I never knew a coffee/tea machine would make me feel uneasy. Thanks Keurig.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Chrissycookies
review_text: I love this coffee maker. It makes tasty coffee and the strong setting really does make it stronger, although it s very noisy and takes more than twice the time as a regular cup: it s worth it IMO when I want a good strong cup or if I buy too weak of a blend. I really can t find a problem with the way this thing functions. Also makes much better tasting coffee than my old keurig model.
review_title: Makes great coffee. Only one gripe...
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Betty W.
review_text: I've had mine, just like this one, for a little over a year. I began having problems after first month. I think it must have been a used, reconditioned one. I have called several times and followed their directions, but to no avail I have bought 2 bottles of descaler, sometimes it would work better, but never like it should. You only get one ounce at a time, no matter what button you push and it makes a noise like a threshing machine. My son bought one same time I did, 4 in his family, never had a problem yet. I am only user of mine, and so frustrated. My son says "just buy another one, get same model as mine". Guess I will have to do that as I have about 300 Keurig Pods, that I can't use. I would gladly return it, if they sent me a return label.
review_title: Wish I could return this thing. . . . .
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Veonn E.
review_text: Bought at Sam's Club on sale for $68. The price was right to try it.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Justaday
review_text: I got this as a back up for when my other keurig died. Finally got to use this one and i hate it. It s incredibly loud when heating up and dispensing, you have to have the the top down for preheating then re open it which i didn t have to do with my old one, and when i hit the power button after it dispenses coffee it does not turn off but keeps re heating. I have to manually unplug it from the wall to shut it off. Really wish i had just gotten the same version as before but i wanted this one as i liked the color.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: And if you use it regularly you might wanna be aware of how dirty the needle is otherwise it won't brew. Other than that though it's really convenient and compact.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: L. Gandy
review_text: I was given a Keurig back in 2010 and it was a good workhorse.  I should have bought that again because it was still available when my old one crapped out on me.  But I liked the red (my kitchen is stuff is red ) and bought this one.  I have been fine with it until I bought some McD, Green Mountain  and Donut Shop cups.  The dang things exploded in the Keurig.  A real mess.  I found out if you Keurig cup has a little dome (excess air under the foil) as these did, this unit will do that.  I never had that problem with the old one.  So I had to stick a little pin prick in it and release the air before using them.  Nine times out of ten I still get grounds in my cup - which I do have to strain out with my yogurt strainer - but they don't explode.  I will compensate with this until this one craps out on me and hopefully by then Keurig will.  I too also wish that it would make at least a 12 ounce cup.  I have to use two cups to get my mug of coffee every morning!
review_title: Not as Good as my old one
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Catherine
review_text: I don t like this model. The water tank is awkward to remove, fill, and replace. I always end up spilling water all over the place. The top of the water reserve doesn t sit tightly on the water tank either. The machine does not work with Cafe Escapes - the machine doesn t complete the brew  and a water pressure message pops up. Finally, the brewing sound reminds me of the breast pump - which is an activity I don t care to relive and remember every time I go for a cup of coffee.
review_title: Awkward, doesn t work with Cafe Escapes.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Steve
review_text: I m a mechanical design engineer and I believe this machine has very few flaws in design, and has to be one of the best if not the best design out there. It can make k cups and regular ground coffee (If  My K Cup 2.0/universal  is purchased), and all parts in contact with coffee are easily removable and washable.
review_title: Filtered, cleanable and versatile. Very well engineered, and worth spending extra
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: K. Young
review_text: I'm a fan of a huge struggle to obtain a cup of coffee in the morning so this is great. Several times I've gotten a message that my brew was interrupted bc of a water pressure problem. What am I supposed to do about that?? This morning it worked correctly and I was able to get a nice full cup of coffee grinds... Yum. That's happened multiple times from a keurig brand kcup.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: MK7 GTI SE
review_text: I enjoy my Keurig and use it for coffee, instant mashed potatoes, instant grits, tea, etc. with the handy water only function.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Hydrogibbon
review_text: I purchased this coffee maker from a local store.  It makes great coffee if you buy a brand approved by Keurig.  However, if you buy a brand not approved by Keurig there is a security thing in there that won't let it brew.  The k-cups are identical but the machine must read the brand on the label and will not brew.  I'm assuming they must charge coffee roasters a fee to allow their brand to be used in the Keurig.  It reminds me of store owners paying for protection.  I'm sorry I purchased this machine.
review_title: It makes great coffee if you buy a brand approved by Keurig
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: ErinE
review_text: I previously owned the K300... a 2.0 kurig machine... that worked adequately, though never "shut off" and seemed to waste electricity. The Power icon on the screen is just for looks on this model too- you can't shut it off without unplugging.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Colleen
review_text: In the trash in less than 2 years. I had nothing but problems with mine. It was always getting clogged with coffee and  constantly having to clean out. Had to keep a paperclip very close by to poke the needle to get the coffee grounds out. Hard to fill the water  reserve compared to other models. I did like the color though.  I still like the brand. Ended up buying a higher model. This model also does not have an automatic on and off Feature like higher models do
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Foosgal
review_text: I do not like the water tank on the back.  The lid has to fit so so.  I've already had to "clean the needle" twice & have had it about 4 weeks.  It even comes with the equipment to clean the needle.  I'm still thiniking of returning it.
review_title: I do not like the water tank on the back
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Lee F
review_text: I have a Keurig Platinum in the kitchen - no problems ever - so got this for early morning coffee in my downstairs office. Wish I'd saved the box to send it back. Every 3-4 brew attempts, it stops brewing and requires needle and basket cleaning. Longest I've gone between this absurd process is 12 cups. And what's with being told to use a paper clip to clean out the needle openings?? This is a poor design, and I'm amazed Keurig had the gall to put it out there under its brand name. Never again.
review_title: Be prepared to clean it every 4th cup...bad
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: sharramama
review_text: So disappointed! I was a loyal Keurig user for years and years after my initial purchase of the Klassic model at Costco. Recently I gave away my reliable beast and downsized to this model. Biggest mistake ever. It is constantly giving me the same error message. I youtubed how to clean out the cup compartment and needles, I have done the maintenance and I've only had this thing two months. The error messages  began in week two. I should have returned it, but I loved the size and look and hoped maybe it was just new machine kinks.
review_title: Error Message: "You bought the wrong machine"
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Alexandra
review_text: I got the Oasis color because it was on sale and that was one of the colors left. But it's actually a nice sea foam type color. I love this coffee maker. I use it several times a day. I had to give up caffeine because of insomnia. And I needed something to make quality decaf. My favorite is Peet's House Decaf. Surprisingly, because I've always been such a Starbucks person. But you can leave the machine on all day, and it's ready to make you a fresh cup of delicious coffee in a minute or two. I use bottled water as is suggested. You have to replace the water filter and rescale it regularly. But it's pretty easy to do. And it keeps the coffee tasting fresh and yummy! It makes me wonder what gross things are hiding in regular coffee makers that people have for years and use with tap water. And never rescale it and don't have a filter on it. There are so many varieties of k-cups you can get. In both decaf and regular. As well as tea and hot chocolate. And you can also make hot water for soup or tea bags. I have nothing bad to say about my coffee machine. You can take the bottom piece off. And fit a coffee mug underneath. Which is what I usually do. It's a great buy. And well worth every penny.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Alexander Bailey
review_text: You could not make a worse coffee make if you tried.  First off the quality of the coffee it makes is garbage, watered down with grounds in the cup.  Second, it randomly tells me I need to purchase a pod designed for my coffee maker and refuses to brew coffee at random despite being an official pod.  If you're going to put DRM on your coffee maker, at least make it work.  This thing is pathetic, I can't believe it's such a popular coffee maker.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Alan R.
review_text: Just the color our daughter was wanting and the teal color was always sold out in the stores. Only issue was the box was destroyed when it arrived. Looked like the item had been shipped from the seller to Amazon fullfilment in box. Amazon thank goodness put the item in a new box or the item would likely not have arrived. Very surprised when everything was OK inside, but was disappointed that this was the box that had to be wrapped since it was a gift.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Jeremy A.
review_text: I bought this for my office within the past month and probably have one or two cups a day.  It has malfunctioned twice now.  I performed the needle therapy on it the first time and have tried again the second time to no avail.  I called the help number and the Indian lady told me that I should only use Keurig brand cups in it as well as only using bottled water given the fact that the minerals in tap water can clog it.  Now I have a machine that continues not to work and a company that states they can guarantee it since I used tap water and non-Keurig cups.  I've had another Keurig in the past that wasn't just single serve and used it much more often with tap water and non-Keurig cups.  I will be returning this item to Sam's Club and move on to a different company.
review_title: I bought this for my office within the past month ...
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Kimberly
review_text: NO NO NO. I bought this after using the original keurig for 7+ years daily. It was amazing. I bought this one for the sleek design and color. The coffee tastes AWFUL. It has such a strong plastic and chemical taste it was hard to stomach even the smell. Completely undrinkable. Upon googling this, it's a known and common problem. with this maker. I followed all instructions for soaking the water tank, running vinegar, etc. It was a completely unusuable coffee maker. I went back and bought the Keurig K425 instead and it is fantastic. No problems. Stay away from this model!
review_title: Awful plastic taste - Horrible! Go for K425 instead!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: ShihTzuMom
review_text: I was reluctant to buy another Keurig because my last one died in two years. Well, this on made in 13 months. Its in the trash now. I did not like it, even if it worked. It is tall, so you can't put a drawer for pods under it if your cabinet is low. Also, the reservoir top fits weird. It is curved. I can't tell you how many times it fell into the water. Especially under the cabinet, where you can't see to replace it. Very poor design IMO. I am looking for a different brand now.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: J. Michelle Wynn
review_text: I like it, but they advertised that with a k-mug pod you could get 12 or 14 oz. When I asked where to purchase them, I was told they stopped selling them last year. So, why are they still advertising this as a selling point this year? The coffee maker itself is okay, but I am turned off by the dishonesty in advertising and my children who use it are unhappy that they have to use two pods to fill their mugs. It's just more expensive than is necessary.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Johnny Fab
review_text: Absolute pile of junk. Works great for the first month, then it has issues several times a week after that. Always getting clogged, jammed, plugged, packed, whatever... I finally had enough of the hunk of crap today and unplugged it and boxed it up for a return. It ain't worth the money!
review_title: Works great for the first month
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Kay S. Glenn
review_text: I've had this model for one year.  Thought it was great....until about two months ago.  It began giving me only 1/2 cup of coffee when I pressed the button for a whole cup!  I've been very good about cleaning it every 3 or 4 months with vinegar and water.  It hasn't worked well for the last two months!  It's a pain in the neck.  My husband I have watched some uTube videos from people who've had the same experience.  Tried their suggestions....but nothing works!  I DO NOT RECOMMEND this Keurig product!  Very expensive mistake and very frustrating!  Caveat emptare!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Laurie Fussell
review_text: I had my 1st kuerig for 2 years before experiencing any problems and me and my family loved it. I purchased this one and the touch screen shattered within the first week from literally just operating the machine. I chalked it up to operator error and replaced it with the same model. How disappointing!!  It drips continually, I have to empty the drip tray daily or it overflows. It barely brews a half cup of coffee much less a 10 oz cup. What a waste and it's not as though the machines are any less expensive, they're just made cheaper and less dependable. Guess I'll go back to a regular pot. Even though I throw more coffee away, at least I'm not paying as much for it and I can pour myself a whole cup.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: D. Crow
review_text: Love the Coffee Maker bought the Strawberry Red unit from a different Retailer this time last year for a great price $60 + tax. No issues other than the occasional needle cleaning process.  Just chiming in that the Amazon description is wrong. This unit is not programmable meaning you can not set a programmable timer to come on in the morning and make a cup while getting ready for work.  It will not even automatically power down.  Not unless they added this feature in the last year and did not change the model number. Highly unlikely.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: I have had the experience of owning 2 keurigs both which have lasted less that 2 years in spite of keeping it clean, using filtered water and  following their recommended cleaning procedures. They make you buy these expensive descaling liquid  bottles that do squat  in terms of cleaning.Regular vinegar would do a better job  of descaling in my opinion. The  design  of the filter they provide is very user unfriendly during replacement  for a person with even mild arthritis . Overall their quality SUCKS big time and that is an understatement.
review_title: using filtered water and following their recommended cleaning procedures
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: amandago2882
review_text: I can only assume that those who gave a good review have no problem using store bought, disposable k-cup. The K2, after all, is designed to use none other, and will not work well without immense frustration.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: funny sunny
review_text: Don't waste your money. My wife and I switched to this model at Christmas 2016 from a Keurig Vue brewer. We switched because we wanted something smaller and vue cups don't have near the flavor selection as k-cups. This K250 model has given us nothing but problems. We are casual coffee drinkers, maybe 6 a week. This unit has so many plastic parts that get gummed up with coffee in less than 2 weeks. Requires constant cleaning if you don't like floating sludge in your morning coffee. The needle also needs cleaning repeatedly. Minor design thing the water tank is awkward to place back on the K250 without spilling. The Vue unit in comparison was a work horse and rarely needed cleaning and wish I had kept it now.
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: I received my Keurig K250 in perfect condition on my doorstep. The packaging was sturdy, but not too bulky. It protected the product, which is always a concern when ordering offline for myself. Upon opening my Keurig, I noticed instantly its  color and size. It looked exactly like it was pictured, which is a big plus for me. Compared to the original Keurig, the Keurig K250 appears much sleeker and more convenient. The Keurig is a perfect size for smaller kitchens, which is idea for various college living situations. Keep in mind, with its  smaller size, you cannot use a thermos, tall coffee cup, or a tumbler, simply because they are too tall to fit under the machine s spout, but it is perfect for standard coffee cups.
review_title: I received my Keurig K250 in perfect condition on my doorstep
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Mark T
review_text: I have had many of these coffee makers that were great but needs replacement. This new device is garbage and of inferior quality to the past. I do not like it at all. The machine mis brews several times and almost every other day. The machine does not accept non K cups and that is not acceptable to me. We have been using the K cups and after several mis feeds due to machine we have wasted several and that is costly. This machine is not near the quality of the past and i would step away!!!
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: tpen007

review_text: Worked great until you follow the prompts and Keurig procedure for de-scaling.  The procedure melted the 2.0 sensor and now it wont recognize legitimate pods.  Took me 10 pods and some Google to figure out it was the internal sensor that roasted (the procedure tells you to hot rinse the unit "at least 12 times").  If you have this unit, DONT de-scale it.  Let it break on its own.  It will last longer.  Great job Keurig.  You lost a customer today.

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: Being that it's Christmas time I thought I would try to share some information about Keurig coffee makers. First of all know who you're buying it for, can they really afford what it cost for a Keurig to maintain and use. The pods are very expensive. And on top of the cost they only make a small amount per pod so if you use an average size coffee mug you end up have to use two pods. Like I said very costly. Yes you can get the reusable filters and use your own coffee but that too is expensive. It's expensive in the fact that you use quite a bit more coffee than you would in a regular coffee pot. It's also very messy. You think that it sounds great to be able to make a cup of coffee in one minute but this really isn't true. There is the time it takes to heat the element which is probably more than the time it takes for your drip coffee maker to heat and pour a full pot. The maintenance of the Keurig is very expensive and time-consuming as well. You have to buy water filters and replace them every 2 to 3 months. You have to buy a special cleanser that cost about $20 and is only good for three uses this has to be done every 3 months or so. Unless you are the type of person that could afford to buy expensive cups of coffee such as $4 a cup at Starbucks then this really wouldn't be for you. If you don't want to fool with the mess and the maintenance of a Keurig this is not for you. I'm not totally putting the product down it's just that it's not the easy and convenient thing you would think it is. To make a coffee mug of coffee it's going to take you longer than making a pot of drip coffee. Like I said it being Christmas time I thought that it would be a good idea to spread the truth about this product. After using my Keurig for a year I went to Walmart and bought a 20 dollar Black & Decker drip coffee maker and threw my 150.00 dollar Keurig in the trash.
review_title: Keurig is expensive and high maintenance
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Gerald W. Arcuri
review_text: Time to write an updated - but not changed - review. Albert Einstein once remarked that "perfection of means and confusion of end characterize our age". Keurig has perfected the means ( convenient technology ) to produce a consistently mediocre end ( a nearly tasteless cup of "coffee". ) No one - no matter what coffee you use, including your own - can produce a decent hot beverage resembling properly brewed coffee using these machines. Lord knows, I've tried. So, if you value convenience above all else, buy one of these contraptions. If you actually like the taste of coffee, get some green coffee beans, a nice little home roaster, a burr grinder, and a pour-over funnel, and make the real thing.
review_title: KEURIG: If You Really Don't Like Coffee
product_name: Keurig K250 Single Serve, K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with Strength Control

name: Paramus Guy
review_text: I loved this coffee maker when I first bought it but I've had it for a few months now and I'm thinking of replacing it. It does a great job making coffee but it holds such a little amount of water that I have to fill it two times a day. It seems really silly to have to refill a coffee maker so often.
